679.mithramycin: an antineoplastic drug (trade name Mithracin) used to treat cancer of the testes
679.asparaginase: antineoplastic drug (trade name Elspar) sometimes used to treat lymphoblastic leukemia
679.thiotepa: an antineoplastic drug used to treat certain malignancies
679.antineoplastic antibiotic: an antibiotic drug used as an antineoplastic in chemotherapy

277.internationalist: a member of a socialist or communist international

431.seed oyster: a young oyster especially of a size for transplantation
431.bluepoint: small edible oyster typically from the southern shore of Long Island
431.marine mussel: marine bivalve mollusk having a dark elongated shell; live attached to solid objects especially in intertidal zones
431.shipworm: wormlike marine bivalve that bores into wooden piers and ships by means of drill-like shells
431.razor clam: marine clam having a long narrow curved thin shell

431.thin-shelled mussel: mussel with thin fragile shells having only rudimentary hinge teeth
431.pearl oyster: tropical marine bivalve found chiefly off eastern Asia and Pacific coast of North America and Central America; a major source of pearls
431.ark shell: marine bivalve mollusk having a heavy toothed shell with a deep boat-like inner surface
431.giant northwest shipworm: giant shipworm of the Pacific coast of North America
431.Japanese oyster: a large oyster native to Japan and introduced along the Pacific coast of the United States; a candidate for introduction in Chesapeake Bay
431.sea scallop: a large scallop inhabiting deep waters of the Atlantic coast of North America
431.geoduck: a large edible clam found burrowing deeply in sandy mud along the Pacific coast of North America; weighs up to six pounds; has siphons that can extend to several feet and cannot be withdrawn into the shell
431.piddock: marine bivalve that bores into rock or clay or wood by means of saw-like shells
431.edible mussel: a mussel with a dark shell that lives attached to rocks
431.giant clam: a large clam inhabiting reefs in the southern Pacific and weighing up to 500 pounds
431.quahog: an edible American clam; the heavy shells were used as money by some American Indians
431.soft-shell clam: an edible clam with thin oval-shaped shell found in coastal regions of the United States and Europe
431.bivalve: marine or freshwater mollusks having a soft body with platelike gills enclosed within two shells hinged together
431.scallop: edible marine bivalve having a fluted fan-shaped shell that swim by expelling water from the shell in a series of snapping motions
431.clam: burrowing marine mollusk living on sand or mud; the shell closes with viselike firmness
431.zebra mussel: inch long mollusk imported accidentally from Europe; clogs utility inlet pipes and feeds on edible freshwater mussels
431.window oyster: marine bivalve common in Philippine coastal waters characterized by a large thin flat translucent shell
431.pearly-shelled mussel: the pearly lining of the dark shells is a source of mother-of-pearl
431.freshwater mussel: bivalve mollusk abundant in rivers of central United States
431.saddle oyster: thin-shelled bivalve having the right valve deeply notched
431.cockle: common edible, burrowing European bivalve mollusk that has a strong, rounded shell with radiating ribs
431.oyster: marine mollusks having a rough irregular shell; found on the sea bed mostly in coastal waters
431.bay scallop: a small scallop inhabiting shallow waters and mud flats of the Atlantic coast of North America
431.mussel: marine or freshwater bivalve mollusk that lives attached to rocks etc.

268.source code: program instructions written as an ASCII text file; must be translated by a compiler or interpreter or assembler into the object code for a particular computer before execution
268.text file: (computer science) a computer file that contains text (and possibly formatting instructions) using seven-bit ASCII characters
268.master file: (computer science) a computer file that is used as the authority in a given job and that is relatively permanent
268.transaction file: (computer science) a computer file containing relatively transient data about a particular data processing task
268.input file: (computer science) a computer file that contains data that serve as input to a device or program
268.backup file: (computer science) a computer file dedicated to storing and updating computer backups
268.binary file: (computer science) a computer file containing machine-readable information that must be read by an application; characters use all 8 bits of each byte
268.ASCII text file: a text file that contains only ASCII characters without special formatting
268.output file: (computer science) a computer file that contains data that are the output of a device or program
268.read-only file: (computer science) a file that you can read but cannot change
268.web page: a document connected to the World Wide Web and viewable by anyone connected to the internet who has a web browser
268.disk file: (computer science) a computer file stored on a magnetic disk and identified by a unique label
268.computer file: (computer science) a file maintained in computer-readable form
268.home page: the opening page of a web site

624.winter savory: resinous leaves used in stews and stuffings and meat loaf
624.lemon balm: lemony leaves used for a tisane or in soups or fruit punches
624.parsley: aromatic herb with flat or crinkly leaves that are cut finely and used to garnish food
624.souchong: a fine quality of black tea native to China
624.herb: aromatic potherb used in cookery for its savory qualities
624.thyme: leaves can be used as seasoning for almost any meat and stews and stuffings and vegetables
624.Darjeeling: a fine variety of black tea grown in northern India
624.lovage: stalks eaten like celery or candied like angelica; seeds used for flavoring or pickled like capers
624.sweet woodruff: fragrant dark green leaves used to flavor May wine
624.tea: dried leaves of the tea shrub; used to make tea
624.costmary: leaves used sparingly (because of bitter overtones) in sauces and soups and stuffings
624.tea bag: a measured amount of tea in a bag for an individual serving of tea
624.coriander: parsley-like herb used as seasoning or garnish
624.clary sage: fresh leaves used in omelets and fritters and with lamb
624.caraway: leaves used sparingly in soups and stews
624.comfrey: leaves make a popular tisane; young leaves used in salads or cooked
624.bay leaf: dried leaf of the bay laurel
624.chervil: fresh ferny parsley-like leaves used as a garnish with chicken and veal and omelets and green salads and spinach
624.savory: either of two aromatic herbs of the mint family
624.marjoram: pungent leaves used as seasoning with meats and fowl and in stews and soups and omelets
624.oolong: Chinese tea leaves that have been partially fermented before being dried
624.rue: leaves sometimes used for flavoring fruit or claret cup but should be used with great caution: can cause irritation like poison ivy

624.mint: the leaves of a mint plant used fresh or candied
624.orange pekoe: a superior grade of black tea; grown in India and Sri Lanka and Java
624.summer savory: herb with delicately flavored leaves with many uses
624.sweet cicely: fresh ferny leaves and green seeds used as garnish in salads and cold vegetables; dried seeds used in confectionery and liqueurs
624.fines herbes: a mixture of finely chopped fresh herbs
624.dill: aromatic threadlike foliage of the dill plant used as seasoning
624.green tea: tea leaves that have been steamed and dried without fermenting
624.hyssop: bitter leaves used sparingly in salads; dried flowers used in soups and tisanes
624.angelica: aromatic stems or leaves or roots of Angelica Archangelica
624.rosemary: extremely pungent leaves used fresh or dried as seasoning for especially meats
624.basil: leaves of the common basil; used fresh or dried
624.borage: an herb whose leaves are used to flavor sauces and punches; young leaves can be eaten in salads or cooked
624.sage: aromatic fresh or dried grey-green leaves used widely as seasoning for meats and fowl and game etc
624.tarragon: fresh leaves (or leaves preserved in vinegar) used as seasoning
624.hyson: a Chinese green tea with twisted leaves

414.limpet: mollusk with a low conical shell
414.shellfish: meat of edible aquatic invertebrate with a shell (especially a mollusk or crustacean)
414.littleneck: a quahog when young and small; usually eaten raw; an important food popular in New York
414.bluepoint: oysters originally from Long Island Sound but now from anywhere along the northeastern seacoast; usually eaten raw
414.soft-shell crab: freshly molted crab with new shell still tender and flexible

414.crab legs: legs of especially Alaska king crabs
414.huitre: edible body of any of numerous oysters

414.oysters Rockefeller: oysters spread with butter and spinach and seasonings and baked on the half shell

414.crayfish: tiny lobster-like crustaceans usually boiled briefly

414.mussel: black marine bivalves usually steamed in wine

414.stone crab: pale flesh with delicate texture and flavor; found in Florida but now very rare

98.credit card: a card (usually plastic) that assures a seller that the person using it has a satisfactory credit rating and that the issuer will see to it that the seller receives payment for the merchandise delivered
98.keycard: a plastic card that has a magnetically coded strip that is scanned in order to operate a mechanism
98.ration card: a card certifying the bearer's right to purchase rationed goods
98.debit card: a card (usually plastic) that enables the holder to withdraw money or to have the cost of purchases charged directly to the holder's bank account
98.cash card: a credit card that entitles the holder to receive cash
98.license number: the number on the license plate that identifies the car that bears it
98.calling card: a card that is used instead of cash to make telephone calls
98.personal identification number: a number you choose and use to gain access to various accounts
98.number: a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification
98.membership card: a card certifying membership in an organization
98.password: a secret word or phrase known only to a restricted group
98.library card: a card certifying the bearer's right to use the library
98.bank card: a credit card issued by a bank
98.green card: a card that identifies the bearer as an alien with permanent resident status in the United States
98.union card: a card certifying membership in a labor union
98.Social Security number: the number of a particular individual's Social Security account
98.bank identification number: an identification number consisting of a two-part code assigned to banks and savings associations; the first part shows the location and the second identifies the bank itself
98.key: a generic term for any device whose possession entitles the holder to a means of access
98.card: a card certifying the identity of the bearer
98.positive identification: evidence proving that you are who you say you are; evidence establishing that you are among the group of people already known to the system; recognition by the system leads to acceptance
98.ID: a card or badge used to identify the bearer
98.business card: a card on which are printed the person's name and business affiliation
98.donor card: a card that you carry on your person and that authorizes the use of your organs for transplantation after your death
98.smart card: a plastic card containing a microprocessor that enables the holder to perform operations requiring data that is stored in the microprocessor; typically used to perform financial transactions

242.trickery: verbal misrepresentation intended to take advantage of you in some way
242.bill of goods: communication (written or spoken) that persuades someone to accept something untrue or undesirable
242.hedge: an intentionally noncommittal or ambiguous statement
242.subterfuge: something intended to misrepresent the true nature of an activity
242.pretext: something serving to conceal plans; a fictitious reason that is concocted in order to conceal the real reason
242.bluff: pretense that your position is stronger than it really is
242.evasion: a statement that is not literally false but that cleverly avoids an unpleasant truth
242.quibble: an evasion of the point of an argument by raising irrelevant distinctions or objections
242.humbug: communication (written or spoken) intended to deceive
242.hypocrisy: an expression of agreement that is not supported by real conviction
242.putoff: a pretext for delay or inaction
242.doublespeak: any language that pretends to communicate but actually does not
242.exaggeration: making to seem more important than it really is
242.facade: a showy misrepresentation intended to conceal something unpleasant
242.circumlocution: an indirect way of expressing something
242.crocodile tears: a hypocritical display of sorrow; false or insincere weeping
242.half-truth: a partially true statement intended to deceive or mislead

490.patent system: a legal system for protecting the rights of inventors
490.promotion system: a system for advancing participants to higher-status positions
490.legal system: a system for interpreting and enforcing the laws
490.credit system: a system for allowing people to purchase things on credit
490.pricing system: a system for setting prices on goods or services
490.uninominal system: based on the principle of having only one member (as of a legislature) selected from each electoral district
490.list system: based on the principle of proportional representation; voters choose between party lists, the number elected from each list being determined by the percentage cast for each list out of the total vote
490.voting system: a legal system for making democratic choices
490.system: a procedure or process for obtaining an objective
490.tax system: a legal system for assessing and collecting taxes
490.bail: the legal system that allows an accused person to be temporarily released from custody (usually on condition that a sum of money guarantees their appearance at trial)
490.jury system: a legal system for determining the facts at issue in a law suit

522.aquatint: an etching made by a process that makes it resemble a water color
522.gravure: an intaglio print produced by gravure
522.woodcut: a print made from a woodcut
522.steel engraving: an impression taken from an engraved steel plate
522.linocut: a print that is made from a design carved in relief into a block of linoleum
522.dry point: a print produced by dry point engraving
522.print: a picture or design printed from an engraving
522.contact print: a print made by exposing a photosensitive surface to direct contact with a photographic negative
522.copperplate: a print made from an engraved copperplate
522.photolithograph: a lithograph produced by photographically produced plates
522.etching: an impression made from an etched plate
522.silkscreen: a print made using a stencil process in which an image or design is superimposed on a very fine mesh screen and printing ink is squeegeed onto the printing surface through the area of the screen that is not covered by the stencil
522.engraving: a print made from an engraving
522.mezzotint: print produced by an engraving that has been scraped to represent light or shade
522.linecut: a print obtained from a line drawing

112.diamagnetism: phenomenon exhibited by materials like copper or bismuth that become magnetized in a magnetic field with a polarity opposite to the magnetic force; unlike iron they are slightly repelled by a magnet
112.electromagnetism: magnetism produced by an electric current
112.hydrogen bond: a chemical bond consisting of a hydrogen atom between two electronegative atoms (e.g., oxygen or nitrogen) with one side be a covalent bond and the other being an ionic bond
112.ferrimagnetism: a phenomenon in ferrites where there can be incomplete cancellation of antiferromagnetic arranged spins giving a net magnetic moment
112.covalent bond: a chemical bond that involves sharing a pair of electrons between atoms in a molecule
112.peptide bond: the primary linkage of all protein structures; the chemical bond between the carboxyl groups and amino groups that unites a peptide
112.ferromagnetism: phenomenon exhibited by materials like iron (nickel or cobalt) that become magnetized in a magnetic field and retain their magnetism when the field is removed
112.cross-link: a side bond that links two adjacent chains of atoms in a complex molecule
112.double bond: a covalent bond in which two pairs of electrons are shared between two atoms
112.ionic bond: a chemical bond in which one atom loses an electron to form a positive ion and the other atom gains an electron to form a negative ion
112.paramagnetism: materials like aluminum or platinum become magnetized in a magnetic field but it disappears when the field is removed
112.antiferromagnetism: magnetic field creates parallel but opposing spins; varies with temperature
112.coordinate bond: a covalent bond in which both electrons are provided by one of the atoms
112.affinity: (immunology) the attraction between an antigen and an antibody
112.van der Waal's forces: relatively weak attraction between neutral atoms and molecules arising from polarization induced in each particle by the presence of other particles
112.magnetism: attraction for iron; associated with electric currents as well as magnets; characterized by fields of force
112.metallic bond: a chemical bond in which electrons are shared over many nuclei and electronic conduction occurs
112.gravity: (physics) the force of attraction between all masses in the universe; especially the attraction of the earth's mass for bodies near its surface; ; ; --Albert Einstein
112.attraction: the force by which one object attracts another

631.plant louse: any of several small insects especially aphids that feed by sucking the juices from plants
631.adelgid: any of various insects that feed and form galls on conifers
631.woolly adelgid: an insect that feeds on hemlocks; its egg sacs are small fuzzy white balls like artificial snow on a Christmas tree
631.apple aphid: bright green aphid; feeds on and causes curling of apple leaves
631.aphid: any of various small plant-sucking insects
631.jumping plant louse: small active cicada-like insect with hind legs adapted for leaping; feeds on plant juices
631.oak blight: a black plant louse that lives on oaks and dogwoods
631.woolly aphid: secretes a waxy substance like a mass of fine curly white cotton or woolly threads
631.blackfly: blackish aphid that infests e.g. beans and sugar beets
631.woolly apple aphid: primarily a bark feeder on aerial parts and roots of apple and other trees
631.greenfly: greenish aphid; pest on garden and crop plants
631.green peach aphid: yellowish green aphid that is especially destructive to peaches
631.ant cow: excretes a honeylike substance eaten by ants

406.insurance: promise of reimbursement in the case of loss; paid to people or companies so concerned about hazards that they have made prepayments to an insurance company
406.tontine: a form of life insurance whereby on the death or default of a participant his share is distributed to the remaining members
406.liability insurance: insurance that provides protection from claims arising from injuries or damage to other people or property
406.term insurance: low-cost insurance that is valid only for a stated period of time and has no cash surrender value or loan value
406.assurance: a British term for some kinds of insurance
406.hazard insurance: insurance that provides protection against certain risks such as storms or fires
406.coinsurance: insurance issued jointly by two or more underwriters
406.malpractice insurance: insurance purchased by physicians and hospitals to cover the cost of being sued for malpractice
406.whole life insurance: insurance on the life of the insured for a fixed amount at a definite premium that is paid each year in the same amount during the entire lifetime of the insured
406.health maintenance organization: group insurance that entitles members to services of participating hospitals and clinics and physicians
406.life insurance: insurance paid to named beneficiaries when the insured person dies
406.automobile insurance: insurance against loss due to theft or traffic accidents
406.business interruption insurance: insurance that provides protection for the loss of profits and continuing fixed expenses resulting from a break in commercial activities due to the occurrence of a peril
406.health insurance: insurance against loss due to ill health
406.hedge: any technique designed to reduce or eliminate financial risk; for example, taking two positions that will offset each other if prices change
406.reinsurance: sharing the risk by insurance companies; part or all of the insurer's risk is assumed by other companies in return for part of the premium paid by the insured
406.no fault insurance: a system of automobile insurance where a party who is injured in an automobile accident recovers damages up to a specific amount against his own insurance company regardless of who was responsible for the accident
406.group insurance: insurance that is purchased by a group (such as the employees of a company) usually at a reduced rate to individual members of the group
406.endowment insurance: life insurance for a specified amount which is payable to the insured person at the expiration of a certain period of time or to a designated beneficiary immediately upon the death of the insured
406.self-insurance: insuring yourself by setting aside money to cover possible losses rather than by purchasing an insurance policy
406.hospitalization insurance: insurance that pays all or part of a patient's hospital expense
406.fire insurance: insurance against loss due to fire
406.security: defense against financial failure; financial independence

433.color: the timbre of a musical sound
433.nasality: a quality of the voice that is produced by nasal resonators
433.register: (music) the timbre that is characteristic of a certain range and manner of production of the human voice or of different pipe organ stops or of different musical instruments
433.twang: exaggerated nasality in speech (as in some regional dialects)
433.resonance: the quality imparted to voiced speech sounds by the action of the resonating chambers of the throat and mouth and nasal cavities
433.shrillness: having the timbre of a loud high-pitched sound
433.head register: the higher ranges of the voice in speaking or singing; the vibrations of sung notes are felt in the head
433.plangency: having the character of a loud deep sound; the quality of being resonant
433.chest register: the lower ranges of the voice in speaking or singing
433.falsetto: a male singing voice with artificially high tones in an upper register
433.harmonic: any of a series of musical tones whose frequencies are integral multiples of the frequency of a fundamental
433.timbre: (music) the distinctive property of a complex sound (a voice or noise or musical sound)

568.power saw: a power tool for cutting wood

568.hammer: a power tool for drilling rocks

568.table saw: a circular saw mounted under a table or bench so that the blade of the saw projects up through a slot

568.triphammer: a massive power hammer; raised by a cam until released to fall under gravity
568.power tool: a tool driven by a motor

568.bandsaw: an endless saw consisting of a toothed metal band that is driven around two wheels
568.power drill: a power tool for drilling holes into hard materials
568.router: a power tool with a shaped cutter; used in carpentry for cutting grooves
568.chain saw: portable power saw; teeth linked to form an endless chain

568.plane: a power tool for smoothing or shaping wood

175.quarterly: a periodical that is published every quarter (or four issues per year)
175.pictorial: a periodical (magazine or newspaper) containing many pictures
175.journal: a periodical dedicated to a particular subject
175.periodical: a publication that appears at fixed intervals
175.semiweekly: a periodical that is published twice each week (or 104 issues per year)
175.organ: a periodical that is published by a special interest group
175.biweekly: a periodical that is published twice a week or every two weeks (either 104 or 26 issues per year)
175.literary review: a review devoted to literary criticism
175.issue: one of a series published periodically
175.series: a periodical that appears at scheduled times
175.annals: reports of the work of a society or learned body etc
175.digest: a periodical that summarizes the news
175.extra: an additional edition of a newspaper (usually to report a crisis)
175.semimonthly: a periodical that is published twice each month (or 24 issues per year)
175.weekly: a periodical that is published every week (or 52 issues per year)
175.review: a periodical that publishes critical essays on current affairs or literature or art
175.bimonthly: a periodical that is published twice a month or every two months (either 24 or 6 issues per year)
175.house organ: a periodical published by a business firm for its employees and customers
175.monthly: a periodical that is published every month (or 12 issues per year)

137.thalassemia: an inherited form of anemia caused by faulty synthesis of hemoglobin
137.sideroblastic anemia: refractory anemia characterized by sideroblasts in the bone marrow
137.chlorosis: iron deficiency anemia in young women; characterized by weakness and menstrual disturbances and a green color to the skin
137.transient ischemic attack: brief episode in which the brain gets insufficient blood supply; symptoms depend on the site of the blockage
137.anemia: a deficiency of red blood cells
137.aplastic anemia: anemia characterized by pancytopenia resulting from failure of the bone marrow; can be caused by neoplasm or by toxic exposure
137.sickle-cell anemia: a congenital form of anemia occurring mostly in blacks; characterized by abnormal blood cells having a crescent shape
137.hypochromic anemia: anemia characterized by a decrease in the concentration of corpuscular hemoglobin
137.erythroblastosis fetalis: severe anemia in newborn babies; the result of Rh incompatibility between maternal and fetal blood; typically occurs when the child of an Rh-negative mother inherits Rh-positive blood from the father; can be diagnosed before birth by amniocentesis
137.metaplastic anemia: pernicious anemia in which the various formed elements in the blood are changed
137.hyperchromic anemia: anemia characterized by an increase in the concentration of corpuscular hemoglobin
137.favism: anemia resulting from eating fava beans; victims have an inherited blood abnormality and enzyme deficiency
137.ischemic stroke: the most common kind of stroke; caused by an interruption in the flow of blood to the brain (as from a clot blocking a blood vessel)
137.iron deficiency anemia: a form of anemia due to lack of iron in the diet or to iron loss as a result of chronic bleeding
137.ischemia: local anemia in a given body part sometimes resulting from vasoconstriction or thrombosis or embolism
137.pernicious anemia: a chronic progressive anemia of older adults; thought to result from a lack of intrinsic factor (a substance secreted by the stomach that is responsible for the absorption of vitamin B12)
137.Cooley's anemia: a fatal form of homozygous thalassemia (inherited from both parents) in which there is no hemoglobin; skeletal deformations; heart and spleen and liver enlarged
137.hypoplastic anemia: anemia resulting from inadequately functioning bone marrow; can develop into aplastic anemia
137.Fanconi's anemia: a rare congenital anemia characterized by pancytopenia and hypoplasia of the bone marrow
137.macrocytic anemia: anemia in which the average size of erythrocytes is larger than normal
137.refractory anemia: any of various anemic conditions that are not successfully treated by any means other than blood transfusions (and that are not associated with another primary disease)
137.hemolytic anemia: anemia resulting from destruction of erythrocytes
137.microcytic anemia: anemia in which the average size of erythrocytes is smaller than normal
137.megaloblastic anemia: anemia characterized by many large immature and dysfunctional red blood cells (megaloblasts) in the bone marrow; associated with pernicious anemia

231.red grouse: reddish-brown grouse of upland moors of Great Britain
231.European black grouse: large northern European grouse that is black with a lyre-shaped tail
231.ruffed grouse: valued as a game bird in eastern United States and Canada
231.lesser prairie chicken: a smaller prairie chicken of western Texas
231.sharp-tailed grouse: large grouse of prairies and open forests of western North America
231.grouse: popular game bird having a plump body and feathered legs and feet
231.prairie chicken: brown mottled North American grouse of western prairies
231.greater prairie chicken: the most common variety of prairie chicken
231.ptarmigan: large Arctic and subarctic grouse with feathered feet and usually white winter plumage
231.sage grouse: large grouse of sagebrush regions of North America
231.black grouse: grouse of which the male is bluish-black
231.spruce grouse: North American grouse that feeds on evergreen buds and needles
231.Asian black grouse: a black grouse of western Asia

302.grid: a cooking utensil of parallel metal bars; used to grill fish or meat

302.cooking utensil: a kitchen utensil made of material that does not melt easily; used for cooking

302.roaster: a special cooking pan for roasting

334.stock index: index based on a statistical compilation of the share prices of a number of representative stocks

3.institution: a custom that for a long time has been an important feature of some group or society

340.reconsideration: thinking again about a choice previously made

645.dust contamination: state of being contaminated with dust

224.identity: an operator that leaves unchanged the element on which it operates

426.atomization: annihilation by reducing something to atoms

87.address: the manner of speaking to another individual

691.boot: a form of foot torture in which the feet are encased in iron and slowly crushed
691.kittee: a form of torture used by American Indians in which sensitive parts of the body were squeezed between two boards until the victim could bear no more
691.picket: a form of military punishment used by the British in the late 17th century in which a soldier was forced to stand on one foot on a pointed stake
691.sleep deprivation: a form of psychological torture inflicted by depriving the victim of sleep
691.genital torture: blunt or penetrating trauma or rape (vaginal or anal)
691.strappado: a form of torture in which the hands are tied behind a person's back and they are lifted off the ground by a rope tied to their wrists, then allowed to drop until their fall is checked with a jerk by the rope
691.pogrom: organized persecution of an ethnic group (especially Jews)
691.bastinado: a form of torture in which the soles of the feet are beaten with whips or cudgels
691.rack: a form of torture in which pain is inflicted by stretching the body
691.nail pulling: a form of torture in which the fingernails or toenails are removed
691.crucifixion: the infliction of extremely painful punishment or suffering
691.impalement: the act of piercing with a sharpened stake as a form of punishment or torture
691.cruelty: a cruel act; a deliberate infliction of pain and suffering
691.sensory deprivation: a form of psychological torture inflicted by depriving the victim of all sensory input
691.burning: a form of torture in which cigarettes or cigars or other hot implements are used to burn the victim's skin
691.oppression: the act of subjugating by cruelty
691.prolonged interrogation: a form of psychological torture inflicted by questioning the victim for hours
691.child abuse: the physical or emotional or sexual mistreatment of children
691.kia quen: a form of foot torture used by the Chinese in which the victim's foot was placed between three pieces of bamboo and systematically squeezed
691.persecution: the act of persecuting (especially on the basis of race or religion)
691.dismemberment: the removal of limbs; being cut to pieces
691.judicial torture: torture that is sanctioned by the state and executed by duly accredited officials
691.rendition: handing over prisoners to countries where torture is allowed
691.child neglect: failure of caretakers to provide adequate emotional and physical care for a child
691.electric shock: the use of electricity to administer punishment or torture
691.torture: the deliberate, systematic, or wanton infliction of physical or mental suffering by one or more persons in an attempt to force another person to yield information or to make a confession or for any other reason

442.aberrant: one whose behavior departs substantially from the norm of a group

108.regional anatomy: the study of anatomy based on regions or divisions of the body and emphasizing the relations between various structures (muscles and nerves and arteries etc.) in that region

108.dental anatomy: the branch of gross anatomy concerning with the morphology of teeth
108.neuroanatomy: the anatomy of the nervous system
108.histology: the branch of biology that studies the microscopic structure of animal or plant tissues
108.osteology: the branch of anatomy that studies the bones of the vertebrate skeleton
108.gross anatomy: the study of the structure of the body and its parts without the use of a microscope
108.microscopic anatomy: the study of microscopic structures of tissues and organs
108.functional anatomy: the study of anatomy in its relation to function
108.anatomy: the branch of morphology that deals with the structure of animals
108.clinical anatomy: the practical application of anatomical knowledge to diagnosis and treatment
108.developmental anatomy: the branch of anatomy that studies structural changes of an individual from fertilization to maturity
108.cytology: the branch of biology that studies the structure and function of cells
108.comparative anatomy: the study of anatomical features of animals of different species

425.Rogers: United States humorist remembered for his homespun commentary on politics and American society (1879-1935)

619.millboard: stout pasteboard used to bind books

49.McIntosh: early-ripening apple popular in the northeastern United States; primarily eaten raw but suitable for applesauce

49.Golden Delicious: a sweet eating apple with yellow skin
49.Stayman: apple grown chiefly in the Shenandoah Valley
49.Jonathan: red late-ripening apple; primarily eaten raw

49.Baldwin: an American eating apple with red or yellow and red skin

49.Pearmain: any of several varieties of apples with red skins

49.cooking apple: an apple used primarily in cooking for pies and applesauce etc

69.bristlecone pine: small slow-growing upland pine of western United States (Rocky Mountains) having dense branches with fissured rust-brown bark and short needles in bunches of 5 and thorn-tipped cone scales; among the oldest living things some over 4500 years old
69.table-mountain pine: a small two-needled upland pine of the eastern United States (Appalachians) having dark brown flaking bark and thorn-tipped cone scales
69.jack pine: slender medium-sized two-needled pine of eastern North America; with yellow-green needles and scaly grey to red-brown fissured bark
69.pitch pine: large three-needled pine of the eastern United States and southeastern Canada; closely related to the pond pine
69.American white pine: tall-growing pine of eastern North America; bark is brown with longitudinal fissures when mature; valued as a timber tree
69.white pine: any of several five-needled pines with white wood and smooth usually light grey bark when young; especially the eastern white pine
69.pinon pine: a small two-needled or three-needled pinon of Mexico and southern Texas
69.longleaf pine: large three-needled pine of southeastern United States having very long needles and gnarled twisted limbs; bark is red-brown deeply ridged; an important timber tree
69.shortleaf pine: large pine of southern United States having short needles in bunches of 2-3 and red-brown bark when mature
69.limber pine: western North American pine with long needles and very flexible limbs and dark-grey furrowed bark
69.knobcone pine: medium-sized three-needled pine of the Pacific coast of the United States having a prominent knob on each scale of the cone
69.scrub pine: common small shrubby pine of the eastern United States having straggling often twisted or branches and short needles in bunches of 2
69.Japanese black pine: large Japanese ornamental having long needles in bunches of 2; widely planted in United States because of its resistance to salt and smog
69.nut pine: any of several pinons bearing edible nutlike seeds
69.Torrey pine: medium-sized five-needled pine of southwestern California having long cylindrical cones
69.stone pine: medium-sized two-needled pine of southern Europe having a spreading crown; widely cultivated for its sweet seeds that resemble almonds
69.pinon: any of several low-growing pines of western North America
69.southwestern white pine: medium-size pine of northwestern Mexico; bark is dark brown and furrowed when mature
69.black pine: large two-needled timber pine of southeastern Europe
69.Monterey pine: tall California pine with long needles in bunches of 3, a dense crown, and dark brown deeply fissured bark
69.ancient pine: small slow-growing pine of western United States similar to the bristlecone pine; chocolate brown bark in plates and short needles in bunches of 5; crown conic but becoming rough and twisted; oldest plant in the world growing to 5000 years in cold semidesert mountain tops
69.Scotch pine: medium large two-needled pine of northern Europe and Asia having flaking red-brown bark
69.pond pine: large three-needled pine of sandy swamps of southeastern United States; needles longer than those of the northern pitch pine
69.yellow pine: any of various pines having yellow wood
69.Japanese red pine: pine native to Japan and Korea having a wide-spreading irregular crown when mature; grown as an ornamental
69.Parry's pinyon: five-needled pinon of southern California and northern Baja California having (sometimes three-needled or four-needled showing hybridization from Pinus californiarum)
69.western white pine: tall pine of western North America with stout blue-green needles; bark is grey-brown with rectangular plates when mature
69.Swiss mountain pine: low shrubby pine of central Europe with short bright green needles in bunches of two
69.swamp pine: any of several pines that prefer or endure moist situations such as loblolly pine or longleaf pine
69.red pine: pine of eastern North America having long needles in bunches of two and reddish bark
69.loblolly pine: tall spreading three-needled pine of southeastern United States having reddish-brown fissured bark and a full bushy upper head
69.Swiss pine: large five-needled European pine; yields cembra nuts and a resinous exudate
69.bishop pine: two-needled or three-needled pinon mostly of northwestern California coast
69.California single-leaf pinyon: very small tree similar to Rocky mountain pinon but having a single needle per fascicle; similar to Parry's pinyon in range
69.whitebark pine: small pine of western North America; having smooth grey-white bark and soft brittle wood; similar to limber pine
69.Jeffrey pine: tall symmetrical pine of western North America having long blue-green needles in bunches of 3 and elongated cones on spreading somewhat pendulous branches; sometimes classified as a variety of ponderosa pine
69.shore pine: shrubby two-needled pine of coastal northwestern United States; red to yellow-brown bark fissured into small squares
69.single-leaf: pinon of southwestern United States having solitary needles and often many stems; important as a nut pine
69.Rocky mountain pinon: small compact two-needled pinon of southwestern United States; important as a nut pine
69.ponderosa: common and widely distributed tall timber pine of western North America having dark green needles in bunches of 2 to 5 and thick bark with dark brown plates when mature
69.spruce pine: large two-needled pine of southeastern United States with light soft wood

462.dynamical system: (physics) a phase space together with a transformation of that space
462.phase space: (physics) an ideal space in which the coordinate dimensions represent the variables that are required to describe a system or substance
462.chaos: (physics) a dynamical system that is extremely sensitive to its initial conditions
462.space: the unlimited expanse in which everything is located
462.mathematical space: (mathematics) any set of points that satisfy a set of postulates of some kind
462.absolute space: physical space independent of what occupies it
462.metric space: a set of points such that for every pair of points there is a nonnegative real number called their distance that is symmetric and satisfies the triangle inequality
462.Hilbert space: a metric space that is linear and complete and (usually) infinite-dimensional
462.Euclidean space: a space in which Euclid's axioms and definitions apply; a metric space that is linear and finite-dimensional
462.outer space: any location outside the Earth's atmosphere
462.null space: a space that contains no points; and empty space
462.subspace: a space that is contained within another space
462.manifold: a set of points such as those of a closed surface or an analogue in three or more dimensions

325.deputy: a member of the lower chamber of a legislative assembly (such as in France)
325.promulgator: (law) one who promulgates laws (announces a law as a way of putting it into execution)
325.whip: a legislator appointed by the party to enforce discipline
325.filibuster: a legislator who gives long speeches in an effort to delay or obstruct legislation that he (or she) opposes

325.majority leader: leader of the majority party in a legislature

325.Benton: United States legislator who opposed the use of paper currency (1782-1858)
325.state senator: a member of a state senate
325.backbencher: a member of the House of Commons who is not a party leader
325.minority leader: leader of the minority party in a legislature

325.Draco: Athenian lawmaker whose code of laws prescribed death for almost every offense (circa 7th century BC)
325.floor leader: the legislator who organizes his party's strategy
325.lawgiver: a maker of laws; someone who gives a code of laws
325.congressman: a member of the United States House of Representatives
325.Parliamentarian: an elected member of the British Parliament: a member of the House of Commons
325.frontbencher: a member of the House of Commons who is a minister in the government or who holds an official position in an opposition party
325.legislator: someone who makes or enacts laws

697.infrared ray: a ray of infrared radiation; produces a thermal effect (as from an infrared lamp)
697.light: (physics) electromagnetic radiation that can produce a visual sensation
697.counterglow: a faint spot of light in the night sky that appears directly opposite the position of the sun; a reflection of sunlight by micrometeoric material in space
697.fluorescence: light emitted during absorption of radiation of some other (invisible) wavelength
697.meteor: a streak of light in the sky at night that results when a meteoroid hits the earth's atmosphere and air friction causes the meteoroid to melt or vaporize or explode
697.aureole: the outermost region of the sun's atmosphere; visible as a white halo during a solar eclipse
697.twilight: the diffused light from the sky when the sun is below the horizon but its rays are refracted by the atmosphere of the earth
697.scintillation: (physics) a flash of light that is produced in a phosphor when it absorbs a photon or ionizing particle
697.half-light: a greyish light (as at dawn or dusk or in dim interiors)
697.candlelight: the light provided by a burning candle
697.radiance: the amount of electromagnetic radiation leaving or arriving at a point on a surface
697.torchlight: light from a torch or torches
697.luminescence: light not due to incandescence; occurs at low temperatures
697.friar's lantern: a pale light sometimes seen at night over marshy ground
697.incandescence: the phenomenon of light emission by a body as its temperature is raised
697.laser beam: a beam of light generated by a laser
697.beam: a column of light (as from a beacon)
697.low beam: the beam of a car's headlights that provides illumination for a short distance
697.firelight: the light of a fire (especially in a fireplace)
697.high beam: the beam of a car's headlights that provides distant illumination
697.phosphorescence: a fluorescence that persists after the bombarding radiation has ceased
697.heat ray: a ray that produces a thermal effect
697.corona: one or more circles of light seen around a luminous object
697.bioluminescence: luminescence produced by physiological processes (as in the firefly)
697.sky glow: illumination of the night sky in urban areas
697.sunburst: a sudden emergence of the sun from behind clouds
697.gaslight: light yielded by the combustion of illuminating gas
697.glow: a steady even light without flames
697.chemiluminescence: luminescence resulting from a chemical reaction as the oxidation of luciferin in fireflies

110.superfetation: fertilization of a second ovum after a pregnancy has begun; results in two fetuses of different ages in the uterus at the same time
110.fertilization: creation by the physical union of male and female gametes; of sperm and ova in an animal or pollen and ovule in a plant
110.pollination: transfer of pollen from the anther to the stigma of a plant
110.cleistogamy: the production of small nonopening self-pollinating flowers
110.self-fertilization: fertilization by the union of male and female gametes from the same individual
110.superfecundation: fertilization of two or more ova released during the same menstrual cycle by sperm from separate acts of coitus (especially by different males)
110.self-pollination: fertilization by transfer of pollen from the anthers to the stigma of the same flower
110.cross-fertilization: fertilization by the union of male and female gametes from different individual of the same species
110.cross-pollination: fertilization by transfer of pollen from the anthers of one flower to the stigma of another

116.modulation: (electronics) the transmission of a signal by using it to vary a carrier wave; changing the carrier's amplitude or frequency or phase
116.spam: unwanted e-mail (usually of a commercial nature sent out in bulk)
116.broadcast medium: a medium that disseminates via telecommunications
116.interrogation: a transmission that will trigger an answering transmission from a transponder
116.uplink: a transmission from Earth to a spacecraft or the path of such a transmission
116.circulation: the dissemination of copies of periodicals (as newspapers or magazines)
116.channel: a path over which electrical signals can pass
116.medium: (usually plural) transmissions that are disseminated widely to the public
116.pulse-time modulation: modulation of the time between successive pulses
116.dissemination: the opening of a subject to widespread discussion and debate
116.freemail: a service providing free email delivery in exchange for exposure to advertising
116.propagation: the spreading of something (a belief or practice) into new regions
116.giving: the imparting of news or promises etc.
116.amplitude modulation: modulation of the amplitude of the (radio) carrier wave
116.multimedia: transmission that combine media of communication (text and graphics and sound etc.)
116.frequency modulation: modulation of the frequency of the (radio) carrier wave
116.pulse modulation: modulation that imposes a signal on a train of pulses
116.asynchronous transfer mode: a means of digital communications that is capable of very high speeds; suitable for transmission of images or voice or video as well as data
116.prompt: (computer science) a symbol that appears on the computer screen to indicate that the computer is ready to receive a command
116.hypermedia: a multimedia system in which related items of information are connected and can be presented together
116.digital communication: electronic transmission of information that has been encoded digitally (as for storage and processing by computers)
116.electronic mail: (computer science) a system of world-wide electronic communication in which a computer user can compose a message at one terminal that can be regenerated at the recipient's terminal when the recipient logs in
116.messaging: the sending and processing of e-mail by computer
116.transmission: communication by means of transmitted signals
116.phase modulation: modulation of the phase of the carrier wave
116.fiber optics: the transmission of light signals via glass fibers

599.wood horsetail: Eurasia except southern Russia; northern North America
599.horsetail: perennial rushlike flowerless herbs with jointed hollow stems and narrow toothlike leaves that spread by creeping rhizomes; tend to become weedy; common in northern hemisphere; some in Africa and South America
599.quillwort: any of several spore-bearing aquatic or marsh plants having short rhizomes and leaves resembling quills; worldwide except Polynesia
599.ground pine: any of several club mosses having long creeping stems and erect branches
599.variegated horsetail: northern North America; Greenland; northern and central Europe
599.common horsetail: of Eurasia and Greenland and North America
599.resurrection plant: densely tufted fern ally of southwestern United States to Peru; curls up in a tight ball when dry and expands and grows under moist conditions
599.rock spikemoss: tufted spikemoss forming loose spreading mats; eastern North America
599.marsh horsetail: scouring-rush horsetail widely distributed in wet or boggy areas of northern hemisphere
599.foxtail grass: ground pine thickly covered with bristly leaves; widely distributed in barren sandy or peaty moist coastal regions of eastern and southeastern United States
599.meadow spikemoss: spikemoss forming dense mats; eastern North America
599.scouring rush: evergreen erect horsetail with rough-edged stems; formerly used for scouring utensils
599.fir clubmoss: of northern Europe and America; resembling a miniature fir
599.swamp horsetail: Eurasia; northern North America to Virginia
599.whisk fern: chiefly tropical clump-forming plants of skeletal appearance resembling whisk brooms; lacking roots
599.skeleton fork fern: pantropical epiphytic or terrestrial whisk fern with usually dull yellow branches and minute leaves; America; Japan; Australia
599.spikemoss: any of numerous fern allies of the genus Selaginella
599.club moss: primitive evergreen moss-like plant with spores in club-shaped strobiles
599.fern ally: pteridophytes of other classes than Filicopsida

18.nihilism: complete denial of all established authority and institutions
18.stir: a prominent or sensational but short-lived news event
18.schemozzle: (Yiddish) a confused situation or affair; a mess
18.rioting: a state of disorder involving group violence
18.disorder: a disturbance of the peace or of public order
18.roller coaster: anything characterized by abrupt and extreme changes (especially up and down)
18.anarchy: a state of lawlessness and disorder (usually resulting from a failure of government)
18.combustion: a state of violent disturbance and excitement
18.storm center: a center of trouble or disturbance
18.agitation: a state of agitation or turbulent change or development
18.chaos: a state of extreme confusion and disorder
18.violence: a turbulent state resulting in injuries and destruction etc.
18.turbulence: a state of violent disturbance and disorder (as in politics or social conditions generally)
18.tumult: a state of commotion and noise and confusion
18.balagan: a word for chaos or fiasco borrowed from modern Hebrew (where it is a loan word from Russian)
18.demoralization: a state of disorder and confusion
18.confusion: disorder resulting from a failure to behave predictably
18.earthquake: a disturbance that is extremely disruptive

555.myelography: roentgenography of the spinal cord to detect possible lesions (usually after injection of a contrast medium into the subarachnoid space)
555.thermography: diagnostic technique using a thermograph to record the heat produced by different parts of the body; used to study blood flow and to detect tumors
555.pyelography: roentgenography of the kidney and ureters (usually after injection with a radiopaque dye)
555.lymphangiography: roentgenographic examination of lymph nodes and lymph vessels after injection of a radiopaque contrast medium; produces a lymphangiogram
555.B-scan ultrasonography: the use of ultrasonography to view structure in the back of the eye
555.mammography: a diagnostic procedure to detect breast tumors by the use of X rays
555.prenatal diagnosis: any of the diagnostic procedures used to determine whether a fetus has a genetic abnormality
555.echoencephalography: a noninvasive diagnostic procedure that uses ultrasound to study the anatomy of the brain
555.roentgenography: radiography that uses X-rays to produce a roentgenogram
555.amniocentesis: (pregnancy) extraction by centesis of amniotic fluid from a pregnant woman (after the 15th week of pregnancy) to aid in the diagnosis of fetal abnormalities
555.mammothermography: the use of thermography to detect breast tumors (which appear as hot spots)
555.cardiography: diagnostic procedure consisting of recording the activity of the heart electronically with a cardiograph (and producing a cardiogram)
555.fetoscopy: prenatal diagnosis that allows direct observation of a fetus in the uterus and the withdrawal of fetal blood
555.A-scan ultrasonography: the use of ultrasonography to measure the length of the eyeball
555.cholangiography: roentgenographic examination of the bile ducts after a contrast medium has been injected
555.angiography: roentgenographic examination of blood vessels after injection of a radiopaque contrast medium; produces an angiogram
555.percussion: tapping a part of the body for diagnostic purposes
555.sonography: using the reflections of high-frequency sound waves to construct an image of a body organ (a sonogram); commonly used to observe fetal growth or study bodily organs
555.diagnostic procedure: a procedure followed in making a medical diagnosis
555.succussion: shaking a person to determine whether a large amount of liquid is present in a body cavity
555.auscultation: listening to sounds within the body (usually with a stethoscope)
555.intravenous pyelography: performing pyelography with intravenous injection of a contrast medium
555.electromyography: diagnosis of neuromuscular disorders with the use of an electromyograph
555.arthrography: roentgenographic examination of a joint after injection of radiopaque contrast medium; produces an arthrogram
555.encephalography: roentgenography of the brain after spinal fluid has been replaced by a gas (usually oxygen); produces an encephalogram
555.echocardiography: a noninvasive diagnostic procedure that uses ultrasound to study to structure and motions of the heart

91.splinter group: a faction or sect that has broken away from its parent organization
91.military junta: a group of military officers who rule a country after seizing power
91.Bloomsbury Group: an inner circle of writers and artists and philosophers who lived in or around Bloomsbury early in the 20th century and were noted for their unconventional lifestyles
91.pro-choice faction: those who argue that the decision to have an induced abortion should be made by the mother
91.hard core: the most dedicated and intensely loyal nucleus of a group or movement
91.old guard: a faction that is unwilling to accept new ideas
91.religious right: United States political faction that advocates social and political conservativism, school prayer, and federal aid for religious groups and schools
91.cabal: a clique (often secret) that seeks power usually through intrigue
91.right: those who support political or social or economic conservatism; those who believe that things are better left unchanged
91.bohemia: a group of artists and writers with real or pretended artistic or intellectual aspirations and usually an unconventional life style
91.pro-life faction: those who argue that induced abortion is killing and should be prohibited
91.loop: an inner circle of advisors (especially under President Reagan)
91.left: those who support varying degrees of social or political or economic change designed to promote the public welfare
91.clique: an exclusive circle of people with a common purpose
91.mafia: any tightly knit group of trusted associates
91.kitchen cabinet: an inner circle of unofficial advisors to the head of a government

758.hypnophobia: a morbid fear of falling asleep
758.xenophobia: a fear of foreigners or strangers
758.phonophobia: a morbid fear of sounds including your own voice
758.simple phobia: any phobia (other than agoraphobia) associated with relatively simple well-defined stimuli
758.traumatophobia: a morbid fear of battle or physical injury
758.agoraphobia: a morbid fear of open spaces (as fear of being caught alone in some public place)
758.taphephobia: a morbid fear of being buried alive
758.acrophobia: a morbid fear of great heights
758.school phobia: a child's sudden fear of attending school
758.social phobia: any phobia (other than agoraphobia) associated with situations in which you are subject to criticism by others (as fear of eating in public or public speaking etc)
758.automysophobia: a morbid fear of being dirty
758.mysophobia: a morbid fear of dirt or contamination
758.claustrophobia: a morbid fear of being closed in a confined space
758.astraphobia: a morbid fear of thunder and lightning
758.acarophobia: a morbid fear of small insects and mites and worms
758.phobophobia: a morbid fear of developing a phobia
758.cyberphobia: irrational fear of computers or technology
758.phobia: an anxiety disorder characterized by extreme and irrational fear of simple things or social situations
758.nyctophobia: a morbid fear of night or darkness

303.topical prostaglandin eyedrop: a treatment for glaucoma; the eyedrops increase the outflow of aqueous humor through the uveoscleral pathway

303.barium enema: enema in which a contrast medium (usually barium sulfate) is injected into the rectum and X-rays are taken to search for lesions
303.beta blocker eyedrop: a treatment for glaucoma; the eyedrops reduce intraocular pressure by reducing the production of aqueous humor
303.high colonic: an enema that injects large amounts of fluid high into the colon for cleansing purposes
303.lavage: washing out a hollow organ (especially the stomach) by flushing with water
303.gastric lavage: washing out the stomach with sterile water or a saltwater solution; removes blood or poisons
303.eyedrop: a method of irrigating the eye used by ophthalmologists
303.irrigation: (medicine) cleaning a wound or body organ by flushing or washing out with water or a medicated solution
303.miotic eyedrop: a treatment for glaucoma; the eyedrops increase the outflow of aqueous humor by constricting the pupil
303.enema: an injection of a liquid through the anus to stimulate evacuation; sometimes used for diagnostic purposes

600.magnetohydrodynamics: the study of the interaction of magnetic fields and electrically conducting fluids (as plasma or molten metal)

569.syncopation: a musical rhythm accenting a normally weak beat

738.interchange: mutual interaction; the activity of reciprocating or exchanging (especially information)
738.interaction: a mutual or reciprocal action; interacting
738.relation: (usually plural) mutual dealings or connections among persons or groups
738.placement: contact established between applicants and prospective employees
738.reciprocity: mutual exchange of commercial or other privileges
738.dealings: social or verbal interchange (usually followed by `with')

226.seat: the legal right to sit as a member in a legislative or similar body
226.use: (law) the exercise of the legal right to enjoy the benefits of owning property
226.entitlement: right granted by law or contract (especially a right to benefits)
226.tenure: the right to hold property; part of an ancient hierarchical system of holding lands
226.own right: by title vested in yourself or by virtue of qualifications that you have achieved
226.preemption: the right of a government to seize or appropriate something (as property)
226.visitation right: the right granted by a court to a parent (or other relative) who is deprived of custody of a child to visit the child on a regular basis
226.usufruct: a legal right to use and derive profit from property belonging to someone else provided that the property itself is not injured in any way
226.copyhold: a medieval form of land tenure in England; a copyhold was a parcel of land granted to a peasant by the lord of the manor in return for agricultural services
226.fruition: enjoyment derived from use or possession
226.right of privacy: a legal right (not explicitly provided in the United States Constitution) to be left alone; the right to live life free from unwarranted publicity
226.title: an established or recognized right
226.right of election: in probate law: the legal right of a surviving spouse to elect to take either what the deceased spouse gave under the will or the share of the estate as set forth by statute
226.right of entry: the legal right to take possession of real estate in a peaceable manner
226.patent right: the right granted by a patent; especially the exclusive right to an invention
226.universal suffrage: suffrage for all adults who are not disqualified by the laws of the country
226.conjugal visitation right: the legal right in a prison for the inmate and spouse to have sexual intercourse
226.eminent domain: the right of the state to take private property for public use; the Fifth Amendment that was added to the Constitution of the United States requires that just compensation be made
226.right to vote: a legal right guaranteed by the 15th amendment to the US Constitution; guaranteed to women by the 19th amendment
226.right of offset: (banking) the legal right of a bank to seize deposited funds to cover a loan that is in default
226.freehold: tenure by which land is held in fee simple or for life
226.copyright: a document granting exclusive right to publish and sell literary or musical or artistic work
226.fair use: the conditions under which you can use material that is copyrighted by someone else without paying royalties
226.conjugal right: the right of married persons to the enjoyment of association and sympathy and confidence and domestic happiness and the comfort of living together and eating meals at the same table and profiting from joint property right and the intimacies of domestic relations
226.franchise: a statutory right or privilege granted to a person or group by a government (especially the rights of citizenship and the right to vote)
226.villeinage: tenure by which a villein held land
226.compulsory process: the right of a defendant to have a court use its subpoena power to compel the appearance of material witnesses before the court
226.right of re-entry: the legal right to resume possession (a right that was reserved when a former possession was parted with)

407.judgment lien: lien on a debtor's property that is granted to a creditor by court judgment; lien may be enforced by having the sheriff seize the property and hold a sheriff's sale
407.first mortgage: a mortgage that has priority over all mortgages and liens except those imposed by law
407.landlord's lien: lien on a tenant's property for the satisfaction of unpaid rent or property damage; the landlord is given the status of a preferred creditor with regard to the tenant's property
407.garageman's lien: the extension of a mechanic's lien to include payment for work on automobiles
407.general lien: a lien on all the property owned by a debtor and not just a specific property
407.tax lien: lien of which a tax collector may avail himself in default of taxes (analogous to a judgment lien)
407.chattel mortgage: a loan to buy some personal item; the item (or chattel) is security for the loan
407.conditional sale: a security interest taken by the seller in return for credit
407.collateral: a security pledged for the repayment of a loan
407.mortgage: a conditional conveyance of property as security for the repayment of a loan
407.state tax lien: a lien on the property of a taxpayer that the tax collector can use upon default of payment of taxes
407.warehouseman's lien: right of a warehouseman to retain goods until all storage charges have been paid
407.lien: the right to take another's property if an obligation is not discharged
407.federal tax lien: lien of the United States on all property of a taxpayer who fails to pay the federal government the taxes for which he or she is liable
407.security interest: any interest in a property that secures the payment of an obligation
407.artisan's lien: lien permitting an artisan to retain possession of a piece of work until has been paid for
407.second mortgage: a mortgage that is subordinate to a first mortgage
407.mechanic's lien: lien to secure payment for work and materials in erecting or repairing a building or other structure
407.pledge: a deposit of personal property as security for a debt
407.guarantee: a collateral agreement to answer for the debt of another in case that person defaults

520.support: something providing immaterial assistance to a person or cause or interest
