225.imperativeness: the state of demanding notice or attention
225.requisiteness: the state of being absolutely required
225.necessity: the condition of being essential or indispensable
225.deficit: a deficiency or failure in neurological or mental functioning

106.straight pin: pin consisting of a short straight stiff piece of wire with a pointed end; used to fasten pieces of cloth or paper together
106.spit: a skewer for holding meat over a fire
106.tee: a short peg put into the ground to hold a golf ball off the ground
106.pin: a small slender (often pointed) piece of wood or metal used to support or fasten or attach things
106.wrist pin: pin joining a piston to a connecting rod
106.bobby pin: a flat wire hairpin whose prongs press tightly together; used to hold bobbed hair in place
106.bodkin: formerly a long hairpin; usually with an ornamental head
106.rivet: heavy pin having a head at one end and the other end being hammered flat after being passed through holes in the pieces that are fastened together
106.barrette: a pin for holding women's hair in place
106.safety pin: a pin in the form of a clasp; has a guard so the point of the pin will not stick the user
106.treenail: a wooden peg that is used to fasten timbers in shipbuilding; water causes the peg to swell and hold the timbers fast
106.hatpin: a long sturdy pin used by women to secure a hat to their hair
106.turnspit: a roasting spit that can be turned
106.tent peg: a peg driven into the ground to hold a rope supporting a tent
106.linchpin: pin inserted through an axletree to hold a wheel on
106.peg: a wooden pin pushed or driven into a surface
106.hairpin: a double pronged pin used to hold women's hair in place
106.skewer: a long pin for holding meat in position while it is being roasted
106.bitt pin: a pin through the bitthead to keep the mooring lines from slipping off

748.bitumen: any of various naturally occurring impure mixtures of hydrocarbons
748.chlorobenzene: a colorless volatile flammable liquid with an almond odor that is made from chlorine and benzene; used as a solvent and in the production of phenol and DDT and other organic compounds
748.benzene: a colorless liquid hydrocarbon; highly inflammable; carcinogenic; the simplest of the aromatic compounds
748.gasohol: a gasoline substitute consisting of 90% gasoline and 10% grain alcohol from corn
748.beta-carotene: an isomer of carotene that is found in dark green and dark yellow fruits and vegetables
748.provitamin: vitamin precursor; a substance that is converted into a vitamin in animal tissues
748.butadiene: a gaseous hydrocarbon C4H6; used in making synthetic rubbers
748.liquefied petroleum gas: hydrocarbon gases, usually propane or butane, kept under pressure
748.cymene: any of three isotopes of a colorless aromatic liquid hydrocarbon occurring in the volatile oil of cumin and thyme and used in the manufacture of synthetic resins
748.napalm: gasoline jelled with aluminum soaps; highly incendiary liquid used in fire bombs and flamethrowers
748.chloroprene: derivative of butadiene used in making neoprene by polymerization
748.unleaded gasoline: gasoline that has not been treated with a lead compound
748.coal tar: a tar formed from distillation of bituminous coal; coal tar can be further distilled to give various aromatic compounds
748.aromatic compound: a hydrocarbon containing one or more benzene rings that are characteristic of the benzene series of compounds
748.octane: any isomeric saturated hydrocarbon found in petroleum and used as a fuel and solvent
748.gasoline: a volatile flammable mixture of hydrocarbons (hexane and heptane and octane etc.) derived from petroleum; used mainly as a fuel in internal-combustion engines
748.terpene: an unsaturated hydrocarbon obtained from plants
748.benzene formula: a closed chain of 6 carbon atoms with hydrogen atoms attached
748.provitamin A: an orange isomer of an unsaturated hydrocarbon found in many plants; is converted into vitamin A in the liver
748.gas oil: an oil formed through distillation of petroleum of intermediate boiling range and viscosity
748.leaded gasoline: gasoline treated with a lead compound to reduce motor knocks
748.hydrocarbon: an organic compound containing only carbon and hydrogen
748.ethane: a colorless odorless alkane gas used as fuel
748.dioxin: any of several toxic or carcinogenic hydrocarbons that occur as impurities in herbicides
748.naphthalene: a white crystalline strong-smelling hydrocarbon made from coal tar or petroleum and used in organic synthesis and as a fumigant in mothballs
748.naphtha: any of various volatile flammable liquid hydrocarbon mixtures; used chiefly as solvents
748.aromatic hydrocarbon: a hydrocarbon that contains one or more benzene rings that are characteristic of the benzene series of organic compounds
748.limonene: a liquid terpene with a lemon odor; found in lemons and oranges and other essential oils
748.kerosene: a flammable hydrocarbon oil used as fuel in lamps and heaters
748.pyrene: a pale yellow crystalline hydrocarbon C16H10 extracted from coal tar
748.pitch: any of various dark heavy viscid substances obtained as a residue
748.indene: a colorless liquid hydrocarbon extracted from petroleum or coal tar and used in making synthetic resins

419.badness: used of the degree of something undesirable e.g. pain or weather
419.ferocity: the property of being wild or turbulent
419.intensity: high level or degree; the property of being intense
419.savageness: the property of being untamed and ferocious
419.seriousness: the quality of arousing fear or distress
419.brunt: main force of a blow etc
419.foulness: (of weather) the badness of the weather

557.circumference: the size of something as given by the distance around it
557.airiness: the property of something spacious and abounding in fresh air
557.arm's length: a distance sufficient to exclude intimacy
557.wingspan: linear distance between the extremities of an airfoil
557.skip distance: the shortest distance that permits radio signals (of a given frequency) to travel from the transmitter to the receiver by reflection from the ionosphere
557.narrow gauge: a railroad track (or its width) narrower than the standard 56.5 inches
557.broad gauge: a railroad track (or its width) broader than the standard 56.5 inches
557.diminutiveness: the property of being very small in size
557.gauge: the distance between the rails of a railway or between the wheels of a train
557.capaciousness: spatial largeness and extensiveness (especially inside a building)
557.seating capacity: the number of people that can be seated in a vehicle or auditorium or stadium etc.
557.leg: (nautical) the distance traveled by a sailing vessel on a single tack
557.largeness: the property of having a relatively great size
557.distance: size of the gap between two places
557.grain: the smallest possible unit of anything
557.size: the physical magnitude of something (how big it is)
557.altitude: the perpendicular distance from the base of a geometric figure to the opposite vertex (or side if parallel)
557.standard gauge: railroad track having the standard width of 56.5 inches
557.girth: the distance around a person's body
557.enormousness: unusual largeness in size or extent or number
557.ampleness: the property of impressive largeness in size
557.smallness: the property of having a relatively small size
557.spread: the expansion of a person's girth (especially at middle age)
557.light time: distance measured in terms of the speed of light (or radio waves)
557.wingspread: distance between the tips of the wings (as of a bird or insect) when fully extended

46.forensics: scientific tests or techniques used in the investigation of crimes
46.watch: a purposeful surveillance to guard or observe
46.listening watch: a watch established for the reception of traffic of interest to the unit maintaining the watch
46.stakeout: surveillance of some place or some person by the police (as in anticipation of a crime)
46.spying: keeping a secret or furtive watch
46.detection: a police investigation to determine the perpetrator
46.surveillance of disease: the ongoing systematic collection and analysis of data about an infectious disease that can lead to action being taken to control or prevent the disease
46.surveillance: close observation of a person or group (usually by the police)
46.roundup: the systematic gathering up of suspects by the police

637.natural childbirth: labor and childbirth without medical intervention; no drugs are given to relieve pain or aid the birth process
637.Read method of childbirth: a method of natural childbirth that assumes it is a normal process and that the pain is largely psychological; involves education and breathing exercises to foster relaxation and other exercises
637.childbirth: the parturition process in human beings; having a baby; the process of giving birth to a child
637.alternative birth: a method of childbirth that avoids intrusive high-tech medicine in favor of more natural and homely settings
637.brooding: sitting on eggs so as to hatch them by the warmth of the body
637.laying: the production of eggs (especially in birds)
637.farrow: the production of a litter of pigs
637.premature labor: labor beginning prior to the 37th week of gestation
637.Lamaze method of childbirth: a method that prepares a mother for natural childbirth; the pregnant woman (in classes and at home) practices (usually with the help of a coach) and learns about the physiology of childbirth and techniques of relaxation, concentration, and breathing
637.parturiency: concluding state of pregnancy; from the onset of contractions to the birth of a child
637.Bradley method of childbirth: a method that prepares a mother for natural childbirth by providing education and exercises and nutrition and techniques of breathing and relaxation (with the assistance of the father)
637.active birth: childbirth during which the mother is encouraged to be an active participant
637.Leboyer method of childbirth: a method of childbirth that tries to minimize the trauma for the newborn; delivery occurs in a quiet dimly lit room and the infant's head is not pulled and immediate bonding between mother and child is encouraged
637.hatch: the production of young from an egg

174.gamma hydroxybutyrate: a club drug available in liquid or powder form is taken orally (frequently combined with alcohol); used to incapacitate individuals for the commission of sexual assault and rape
174.methamphetamine: an amphetamine derivative (trade name Methedrine) used in the form of a crystalline hydrochloride; used as a stimulant to the nervous system and as an appetite suppressant
174.ketamine: a general anesthetic and tranquilizer (not a barbiturate) that is administered intravenously or intramuscularly; used mainly by veterinarians or for minor surgery with geriatric or pediatric patients; taken in large doses it causes hallucinations similar to those associated with the use of PCP
174.crack: a purified and potent form of cocaine that is smoked rather than snorted; highly addictive
174.club drug: a controlled substance that is usually taken by young people at dance clubs and raves
174.opium: an addictive narcotic extracted from seed capsules of the opium poppy
174.lysergic acid diethylamide: a powerful hallucinogenic drug manufactured from lysergic acid
174.heroin: a narcotic that is considered a hard drug; a highly addictive morphine derivative; intravenous injection provides the fastest and most intense rush
174.methylenedioxymethamphetamine: a stimulant drug that is chemically related to mescaline and amphetamine and is used illicitly for its euphoric and hallucinogenic effects; it was formerly used in psychotherapy but in 1985 it was declared illegal in the United States
174.basuco: low-grade cocaine mixed with coca paste and cannabis
174.cannabis: the most commonly used illicit drug; considered a soft drug, it consists of the dried leaves of the hemp plant; smoked or chewed for euphoric effect
174.flunitrazepan: a depressant and tranquilizer (trade name Rohypnol) often used in the commission of sexual assault; legally available in Europe and Mexico and Colombia
174.acid: street name for lysergic acid diethylamide
174.hard drug: a narcotic that is considered relatively strong and likely to cause addiction
174.Acapulco gold: a particularly potent variety of marijuana
174.controlled substance: a drug or chemical substance whose possession and use are controlled by law
174.cocaine: a narcotic (alkaloid) extracted from coca leaves; used as a surface anesthetic or taken for pleasure; can become powerfully addictive

144.accommodation ladder: (nautical) a portable ladder hung over the side of a vessel to give access to small boats alongside
144.articulated ladder: a ladder consisting of segments (usually four) that are held together by joints that can lock in place
144.stairs: a flight of stairs or a flight of steps
144.scaling ladder: a ladder used to scale walls (as in an attack)
144.ladder: steps consisting of two parallel members connected by rungs; for climbing up or down
144.extension ladder: a ladder whose length can be extended
144.rope ladder: a ladder with side pieces of rope
144.monkey ladder: a light ladder to the monkey bridge on a ship
144.sea ladder: (nautical) ladder to be lowered over a ship's side for coming aboard
144.Jacob's ladder: (nautical) a hanging ladder of ropes or chains supporting wooden or metal rungs or steps
144.step ladder: a folding portable ladder hinged at the top
144.aerial ladder: mechanically extendible ladder; used on a fire truck

315.fastening: the act of fastening things together
315.spot welding: creating an overlapping joint by welding at small points
315.ligation: (surgery) tying a duct or blood vessel with a ligature (as to prevent bleeding during surgery)
315.welding: fastening two pieces of metal together by softening with heat and applying pressure
315.flash welding: butt welding by creating an electric arc between the two pieces which melts and joins them; used for joining segments of metal pipe
315.butt welding: creating a butt joint by welding
315.fixation: the activity of fastening something firmly in position
315.linkage: the act of linking things together
315.tying: the act of tying or binding things together
315.tubal ligation: a sterilization procedure with women; both Fallopian tubes are tied in two places and the tubes removed in between the ligations

636.faro: a card game in which players bet against the dealer on the cards he will draw from a dealing box
636.all fours: card games in which points are won for taking the high or low or jack or game
636.pitch: an all-fours game in which the first card led is a trump
636.bolivia: a form of canasta in which sequences can be melded
636.auction: a variety of bridge in which tricks made in excess of the contract are scored toward game; now generally superseded by contract bridge
636.high-low: poker in which the high and low hands split the pot
636.seven-up: a form of all fours in which a total of seven points is game
636.royal casino: a form of casino in which face cards have extra point values
636.Go Fish: a card game for two players who try to assemble books of cards by asking the opponent for particular cards
636.monte: a gambling card game of Spanish origin; 3 or 4 cards are dealt face up and players bet that one of them will be matched before the others as the cards are dealt from the pack one at a time
636.hearts: a form of whist in which players avoid winning tricks containing hearts or the queen of spades
636.bridge: any of various card games based on whist for four players
636.no-trump: a version of contract bridge in which no suit is designated as trump for the duration of the hand
636.ecarte: a card game for 2 players; played with 32 cards and king high
636.canfield: a form of solitaire that involves gambling
636.bridge whist: the earliest form of bridge; the dealer could name the trump suit
636.beggar-my-neighbor: a card game for two players in which the object is to win all of the other player's cards
636.contract: a variety of bridge in which the bidder receives points toward game only for the number of tricks he bid
636.straight poker: poker in which each player gets 5 cards face down and bets are made without drawing any further cards
636.draw: poker in which a player can discard cards and receive substitutes from the dealer
636.pinochle: a card game played with a pack of forty-eight cards (two of each suit for high cards); play resembles whist
636.strip poker: poker in which a player's losses are paid by removing an article of clothing
636.whist: a card game for four players who form two partnerships; a pack of 52 cards is dealt and each side scores one point for each trick it takes in excess of six
636.gin: a form of rummy in which a player can go out if the cards remaining in their hand total less than 10 points
636.samba: a form of canasta using three decks of cards and six jokers
636.rouge et noir: a card game in which two rows of cards are dealt and players can bet on the color of the cards or on which row will have a count nearer some number
636.poker: any of various card games in which players bet that they hold the highest-ranking hand
636.baccarat: a card game played in casinos in which two or more punters gamble against the banker; the player wins who holds 2 or 3 cards that total closest to nine
636.solitaire: a card game played by one person
636.cinch: a form of all fours in which the players bid for the privilege of naming trumps
636.spade casino: a form of casino in which spades have the value of one point
636.cribbage: a card game (usually for two players) in which each player is dealt six cards and discards one or two
636.dummy whist: a form of whist with three players; four hands are dealt with the hand opposite the dealer being face up
636.Michigan: a gambling card game in which chips are placed on the ace and king and queen and jack of separate suits (taken from a separate deck); a player plays the lowest card of a suit in his hand and successively higher cards are played until the sequence stops; the player who plays a card matching one in the layout wins all the chips on that card
636.pisha paysha: (Yiddish) a card game for two players one of whom is usually a child; the deck is place face down with one card face upward; players draw from the deck alternately hoping to build up or down from the open card; the player with the fewest cards when the deck is exhausted is the winner
636.fantan: a card game in which you play your sevens and other cards in sequence in the same suit as the sevens; you win if you are the first to use all your cards
636.Napoleon: a card game similar to whist; usually played for stakes
636.canasta: a form of rummy using two decks of cards and four jokers; jokers and deuces are wild; the object is to form groups of the same rank
636.piquet: a card game for two players using a reduced pack of 32 cards
636.klondike: a form of solitaire that begins with seven piles of cards with the top cards facing up; descending sequences of cards of alternating colors are built on these piles; as aces become available they are placed above the seven piles; the object is to build sequences in suit from ace to king as the remaining cards are dealt out one at a time
636.casino: a card game in which cards face up on the table are taken with eligible cards in the hand
636.card game: a game played with playing cards
636.blackjack: a gambling game using cards; the object is to hold cards having a higher count than those dealt to the banker up to but not exceeding 21
636.Russian bank: solitaire with two players using separate packs
636.old maid: a card game using a pack of cards from which one queen has been removed; players match cards and the player holding the unmatched queen at the end of the game is the loser (or `old maid')
636.rummy: a card game based on collecting sets and sequences; the winner is the first to meld all their cards
636.euchre: a card game similar to ecarte; each player is dealt 5 cards and the player making trump must take 3 tricks to win a hand
636.stud: poker in which each player receives hole cards and the remainder are dealt face up; bets are placed after each card is dealt

584.neurosyphilis: syphilis of the central nervous system
584.lymphogranuloma venereum: infectious disease caused by a species of chlamydia bacterium; transmitted by sexual contact; characterized by genital lesions and swelling of lymph nodes in the groin
584.tabes dorsalis: syphilis of the spinal cord characterized by degeneration of sensory neurons and stabbing pains in the trunk and legs and unsteady gait and incontinence and impotence
584.secondary syphilis: the second stage; characterized by eruptions of the skin and mucous membrane
584.gonorrhea: a common venereal disease caused by the bacterium Neisseria gonorrhoeae; symptoms are painful urination and pain around the urethra
584.venereal disease: a communicable infection transmitted by sexual intercourse or genital contact
584.syphilis: a common venereal disease caused by the treponema pallidum spirochete; symptoms change through progressive stages; can be congenital (transmitted through the placenta)
584.chlamydia: a sexually transmitted infection caused by bacteria of the genus Chlamydia
584.primary syphilis: the first stage; characterized by a chancre at the site of infection
584.genital herpes: an infection caused by herpes simplex virus type 2 (HSV-2) that is usually transmitted by sexual contact; marked by recurrent attacks of painful eruptions on the skin and mucous membranes of the genital area
584.tertiary syphilis: the third stage; characterized by involvement of internal organs especially the brain and spinal cord as well as the heart and liver
584.granuloma inguinale: a venereal disease caused by a bacterium of the genus Calymmatobacterium; characterized by a pimply rash of the skin in the genital and groin region

211.fore-topmast: the topmast next above the foremast
211.topgallant: a mast fixed to the head of a topmast on a square-rigged vessel
211.foremast: the mast nearest the bow in vessels with two or more masts
211.boom: any of various more-or-less horizontal spars or poles used to extend the foot of a sail or for handling cargo or in mooring
211.main-topmast: the topmast next above the mainmast
211.jiggermast: any small mast on a sailing vessel; especially the mizzenmast of a yawl
211.jibboom: a spar that extends the bowsprit
211.dolphin striker: spar under the bowsprit of a sailboat
211.mizzenmast: third mast from the bow in a vessel having three or more masts; the after and shorter mast of a yawl, ketch, or dandy
211.royal mast: topmast immediately above the topgallant mast
211.spar: a stout rounded pole of wood or metal used to support rigging
211.gaff: a spar rising aft from a mast to support the head of a quadrilateral fore-and-aft sail
211.mainmast: the chief mast of a sailing vessel with two or more masts
211.sprit: a light spar that crosses a fore-and-aft sail diagonally
211.jury mast: a temporary mast to replace one that has broken off
211.yard: a long horizontal spar tapered at the end and used to support and spread a square sail or lateen
211.bowsprit: a spar projecting from the bow of a vessel
211.topmast: the mast next above a lower mast and topmost in a fore-and-aft rig
211.mast: a vertical spar for supporting sails

523.angling: fishing with a hook and line (and usually a pole)
523.coursing: hunting with dogs (usually greyhounds) that are trained to chase game (such as hares) by sight instead of by scent
523.bait casting: the single-handed rod casting of a relatively heavy (artificial) bait
523.casting: the act of throwing a fishing line out over the water by means of a rod and reel
523.fox hunting: mounted hunters follow hounds in pursuit of a fox
523.fly casting: casting an artificial fly as a lure
523.outdoor sport: a sport that is played outdoors
523.overcast: a cast that falls beyond the intended spot
523.fishing: the act of someone who fishes as a diversion
523.hunt: the pursuit and killing or capture of wild animals regarded as a sport
523.fly-fishing: angling with an artificial fly as a lure
523.pigsticking: the sport of hunting wild boar with spears
523.troll: angling by drawing a baited line through the water
523.surf casting: casting (artificial) bait far out into the ocean (up to 200 yards) with the waves breaking around you
523.battue: a hunt in which beaters force the game to flee in the direction of the hunter

88.ballottement: a palpatory technique for feeling a floating object in the body (especially for determining the position of a fetus by feeling the rebound of the fetus after a quick digital tap on the wall of the uterus)
88.testing: an examination of the characteristics of something
88.keratoscopy: examination of the cornea with a keratoscope to detect irregularities in its anterior surface
88.proctoscopy: visual examination of the rectum and the end of the colon by means of a proctoscope
88.scan: the act of scanning; systematic examination of a prescribed region
88.colonoscopy: visual examination of the colon (with a colonoscope) from the cecum to the rectum; requires sedation
88.genetic screening: analyzing a group of people to determine genetic susceptibility to a particular disease
88.celioscopy: endoscopic examination of the abdomen through the abdominal wall
88.check: the act of inspecting or verifying
88.bank examination: an examination of the affairs and records of a bank by a state or federal bank examiner
88.audit: a methodical examination or review of a condition or situation
88.checkup: a thorough physical examination; includes a variety of tests depending on the age and sex and health of the person
88.once-over: a swift cursory examination or inspection
88.analogy: drawing a comparison in order to show a similarity in some respect
88.spot check: a check on work performance or product quality made at random times without warning
88.confrontation: a focussed comparison; bringing together for a careful comparison
88.follow-up: a subsequent examination of a patient for the purpose of monitoring earlier treatment
88.gonioscopy: an examination of the front part of the eye to check the angle where the iris meets the cornea; it is used to distinguish between open-angle glaucoma and closed-angle glaucoma
88.endoscopy: visual examination of the interior of a hollow body organ by use of an endoscope
88.sigmoidoscopy: visual examination (with a sigmoidoscope) of the lower third of the colon in a search for polyps
88.gastroscopy: visual examination of the stomach by means of a gastroscope inserted through the esophagus
88.contrast: the act of distinguishing by comparing differences
88.screening: testing objects or persons in order to identify those with particular characteristics
88.search: boarding and inspecting a ship on the high seas
88.culdoscopy: endoscopic examination of a woman's pelvic organs by the insertion of a culdoscope through the vagina
88.examination: the act of examining something closely (as for mistakes)
88.time and motion study: an analysis of a specific job in an effort to find the most efficient method in terms of time and effort
88.autopsy: an examination and dissection of a dead body to determine cause of death or the changes produced by disease
88.rhinoscopy: examination of the nasal passages (either through the anterior nares or with a rhinoscope through the nasopharynx)
88.palpation: a method of examination in which the examiner feels the size or shape or firmness or location of something (of body parts when the examiner is a health professional)
88.ophthalmoscopy: examination of the interior of an eye using an ophthalmoscope
88.fine-tooth comb: a method of examining in minute detail
88.hysteroscopy: visual examination of the uterus and uterine lining using an endoscope inserted through the vagina
88.collation: careful examination and comparison to note points of disagreement

435.inside track: a favorable position in a competition
435.favorableness: the quality of being encouraging or promising of a successful outcome
435.bargaining chip: leverage in the form of an inducement or a concession useful in successful negotiations
435.advantage: the quality of having a superior or more favorable position
435.lead: an advantage held by a competitor in a race
435.handicap: advantage given to a competitor to equalize chances of winning
435.start: the advantage gained by beginning early (as in a race)
435.profit: the advantageous quality of being beneficial
435.game misconduct: (ice hockey) a penalty that suspends a player for the remainder of a game (but allows the team to send in a substitute for the suspended player)
435.superiority: the quality of being at a competitive advantage
435.profitableness: the quality of affording gain or benefit or profit
435.tax advantage: an advantage bestowed by legislation that reduces a tax on some preferred activity
435.homecourt advantage: the advantage of playing on your home court in front of fans who are rooting for you
435.leverage: strategic advantage; power to act effectively
435.auspiciousness: the favorable quality of strongly indicating a successful result
435.privilege: a special advantage or immunity or benefit not enjoyed by all
435.penalty: (games) a handicap or disadvantage that is imposed on a competitor (or a team) for an infraction of the rules of the game
435.expedience: the quality of being suited to the end in view
435.favor: an advantage to the benefit of someone or something
435.preference: grant of favor or advantage to one over another (especially to a country or countries in matters of international trade, such as levying duties)

755.bill: a long-handled saw with a curved blade
755.compass saw: a handsaw with a narrow triangular blade for cutting curves
755.crown saw: a saw having teeth around the edge of a hollow cylinder
755.hacksaw: saw used with one hand for cutting metal
755.coping saw: a handsaw with a taut thin blade; used for cutting small curves in wood
755.ripsaw: a handsaw for cutting with the grain of the wood
755.pitsaw: a large two-handed saw formerly used to cut logs into planks; one man stood above the log and the other in a pit below
755.bucksaw: a saw that is set in a frame in the shape of an H; used with both hands to cut wood that is held in a sawbuck
755.folding saw: a saw with a toothed blade that folds into a handle (the way a pocketknife folds)
755.keyhole saw: a handsaw with a long narrow blade for cutting short radius curves; similar to a compass saw
755.handsaw: a saw used with one hand for cutting wood
755.pruning saw: a handsaw used for pruning trees
755.backsaw: a handsaw that is stiffened by metal reinforcement along the upper edge
755.saw: hand tool having a toothed blade for cutting
755.pruner: a long-handled pruning saw with a curved blade at the end and sometimes a clipper; used to prune small trees
755.two-handed saw: a saw with handles at both ends; intended for use by two people
755.crosscut saw: handsaw that cuts at right angles to the grain (or major axis)

408.granola: cereal made of especially rolled oats with dried fruits and nuts and honey or brown sugar
408.cereal: a breakfast food prepared from grain
408.cold cereal: a cereal that is not heated before serving
408.hot cereal: a cereal that is served hot
408.atole: eaten as mush or as a thin gruel
408.frumenty: sweet spiced porridge made from hulled wheat
408.Pablum: a soft form of cereal for infants
408.hasty pudding: cornmeal mush served with sweetening (maple syrup or brown sugar)
408.polenta: a thick mush made of cornmeal boiled in stock or water
408.grits: coarsely ground hulled corn boiled as a breakfast dish in the southern United States

632.finder: optical device that helps a user to find the target of interest
632.portrait lens: a compound camera lens with a relatively high aperture
632.crown lens: a lens made of optical crown glass
632.diverging lens: a lens such that a parallel beam of light passing through it is caused to diverge or spread out
632.Nicol prism: optical device that produces plane-polarized light
632.viewer: an optical device for viewing photographic transparencies
632.Fresnel lens: lens composed of a number of small lenses arranged to make a lightweight lens of large diameter and short focal length
632.achromatic lens: a compound lens system that forms an image free from chromatic aberration
632.Kerr cell: optical device consisting of a transparent cell with two electrodes between two polarizing media; passes light only if the two planes of polarization are parallel; used as a high-speed shutter or to modulate a laser beam
632.erecting prism: a right-angled optical prism used to turn an inverted image upright
632.autofocus: an optical device for focussing a camera or other instrument automatically
632.Abbe condenser: a condenser having 2 or 3 lenses with wide aperture for use in microscopes
632.biprism: an optical device for obtaining interference fringes
632.diffraction grating: optical device consisting of a surface with many parallel grooves in it; disperses a beam of light (or other electromagnetic radiation) into its wavelengths to produce its spectrum
632.anastigmatic lens: a lens designed to correct astigmatism
632.camera lens: a lens that focuses the image in a camera
632.closeup lens: a photographic lens with a short focal length used to take pictures at short ranges
632.objective: the lens or system of lenses in a telescope or microscope that is nearest the object being viewed
632.wide-angle lens: a camera lens having a wider than normal angle of view (and usually a short focal length); produces an image that is foreshortened in the center and increasingly distorted in the periphery
632.sunglass: a convex lens that focuses the rays of the sun; used to start a fire
632.field lens: the lens that is farthest from the eye in an optical device with more than one lens
632.echelon: a diffraction grating consisting of a pile of plates of equal thickness arranged stepwise with a constant offset
632.projector: an optical device for projecting a beam of light
632.prism: optical device having a triangular shape and made of glass or quartz; used to deviate a beam or invert an image
632.contact: a thin curved glass or plastic lens designed to fit over the cornea in order to correct vision or to deliver medication
632.telephoto lens: a camera lens that magnifies the image
632.planetarium: an optical device for projecting images of celestial bodies and other astronomical phenomena onto the inner surface of a hemispherical dome
632.laser: an acronym for light amplification by stimulated emission of radiation; an optical device that produces an intense monochromatic beam of coherent light
632.stereoscope: an optical device for viewing stereoscopic photographs
632.polarimeter: an optical device used to measure the rotation of the plane of vibration of polarized light
632.compound lens: a lens system consisting of two or more lenses on the same axis
632.intraocular lens: an artificial lens that is implanted into the eye of someone to replace a damaged natural lens or someone who has had a cataract removed
632.anastigmat: compound lens or lens system designed to be free of astigmatism and able to form approximately point images
632.meniscus: (optics) a lens that is concave on one side and convex on the other
632.diffuser: optical device that distributes the light of a lamp evenly
632.collimator: optical device consisting of a tube containing a convex achromatic lens at one end and a slit at the other with the slit at the focus of the lens; light rays leave the slit as a parallel beam
632.monocle: lens for correcting defective vision in one eye; held in place by facial muscles
632.lens: a transparent optical device used to converge or diverge transmitted light and to form images
632.eyepiece: combination of lenses at the viewing end of optical instruments
632.coelostat: optical device used to follow the path of a celestial body and reflect its light into a telescope; has a movable and a fixed mirror
632.optical device: a device for producing or controlling light
632.camera lucida: an optical device consisting of an attachment that enables an observer to view simultaneously the image and a drawing surface for sketching it
632.converging lens: lens such that a beam of light passing through it is brought to a point or focus
632.condenser: lens used to concentrate light on an object
632.Rochon prism: optical device that produces plane-polarized ultraviolet light

582.tap: a small metal plate that attaches to the toe or heel of a shoe (as in tap dancing)
582.diffuser: baffle that distributes sound waves evenly
582.halftone: an engraving used to reproduce an illustration
582.platen: the flat plate of a printing press that presses the paper against the type
582.damper: a movable iron plate that regulates the draft in a stove or chimney or furnace
582.planchet: a flat metal disk ready for stamping as a coin
582.subway token: a token that is used to pay for entry to the subway system
582.woodcut: engraving consisting of a block of wood with a design cut into it; used to make prints
582.L-plate: a square plate bearing the letter L that is attached to both ends of a car to indicate that the driver is a learner
582.Frisbee: a light, plastic disk about 10 inches in diameter; propelled with a flip of the wrist for recreation or competition
582.plate: a sheet of metal or wood or glass or plastic
582.etching: an etched plate made with the use of acid
582.engraving: a block or plate or other hard surface that has been engraved
582.discus: a disk used in throwing competitions
582.cylinder head: a detachable plate that covers the closed end of a cylinder chamber in a reciprocating engine or pump
582.centerboard: a retractable fin keel used on sailboats to prevent drifting to leeward
582.brake disk: a disk or plate that is fixed to the wheel; pressure is applied to it by the brake pads
582.stovepipe iron: plate iron that is thinner than tank iron
582.escutcheon: (nautical) a plate on a ship's stern on which the name is inscribed
582.token: a metal or plastic disk that can be redeemed or used in designated slot machines
582.pleximeter: a small thin metal plate held against the body and struck with a plexor in percussive examinations
582.puck: a vulcanized rubber disk 3 inches in diameter that is used instead of a ball in ice hockey
582.gravure: a printing plate used in the process of gravure
582.tank iron: plate iron that is thinner than boilerplate but thicker than sheet iron or stovepipe iron
582.sheet iron: plate iron thinner than tank iron
582.gusset: a metal plate used to strengthen a joist
582.diaphragm: electro-acoustic transducer that vibrates to receive or produce sound waves
582.license plate: a plate mounted on the front and back of car and bearing the car's registration number
582.daggerboard: a removable centerboard on a small sailboat that can be lowered into the water to serve as a keel
582.fishplate: metal plate bolted along sides of two rails or beams
582.copperplate: an engraving consisting of a smooth plate of copper that has been etched or engraved
582.acetate disk: a disk coated with cellulose acetate
582.boilerplate: thick plate iron used in the production of boilers
582.doorplate: a nameplate fastened to a door; indicates the person who works or lives there
582.baffle: a flat plate that controls or directs the flow of fluid or energy
582.grid: a perforated or corrugated metal plate used in a storage battery as a conductor and support for the active material
582.fin keel: a metal plate projecting from the keel of a shallow vessel to give it greater lateral stability
582.deadeye: (nautical) a round hardwood disk with holes and a grooved perimeter used to tighten a shroud
582.linecut: engraving consisting of a block that has been etched or engraved

299.NAND circuit: a logic gate that produces an output that is the inverse of the output of an AND gate
299.PC board: a removable circuit board for a personal computer; fits into a slot in the mother board
299.integrated circuit: a microelectronic computer circuit incorporated into a chip or semiconductor; a whole system rather than a single component
299.printed circuit: computer circuit consisting of an electronic sub-assembly; copper conductors are laminated on an insulating board or card and circuit components are inserted into holes and dip soldered
299.small computer system interface: interface consisting of a standard port between a computer and its peripherals that is used in some computers
299.interface: (computer science) computer circuit consisting of the hardware and associated circuitry that links one device with another (especially a computer and a hard disk drive or other peripherals)
299.parallel interface: an interface between a computer and a printer where the computer sends multiple bits of information to the printer simultaneously
299.serial port: an interface (commonly used for modems and mice and some printers) that transmits data a bit at a time
299.gate: a computer circuit with several inputs but only one output that can be activated by particular combinations of inputs
299.OR circuit: a gate circuit in a computer that fires when any of its inputs fire
299.X-OR circuit: gate for exclusive OR; a circuit in a computer that fires only if only one of its inputs fire
299.circuit board: a printed circuit that can be inserted into expansion slots in a computer to increase the computer's capabilities
299.AND circuit: a circuit in a computer that fires only when all of its inputs fire
299.CPU board: the main circuit board for a computer
299.module: computer circuit consisting of an assembly of electronic components (as of computer hardware)
299.computer circuit: a circuit that is part of a computer

191.content: the proportion of a substance that is contained in a mixture or alloy etc.
191.vacancy rate: the percentage of all rental units (as in hotels) that are unoccupied or not rented at a given time
191.case-to-infection proportion: the number of cases of a disease divided by the number of infections with the agent that causes the disease
191.scale: the ratio between the size of something and a representation of it
191.proportion: the quotient obtained when the magnitude of a part is divided by the magnitude of the whole
191.unemployment rate: the percentage of the work force that is unemployed at any given date
191.percentage: a proportion in relation to a whole (which is usually the amount per hundred)
191.case-fatality proportion: the number of cases of a disease ending in death divided by the number of cases of the disease; usually expressed as a percentage or as the number of deaths per 1000 cases
191.golden section: the proportional relation between two divisions of line or two dimension of a plane figure such that short : long :: long : (short + long)
191.rate: a quantity or amount or measure considered as a proportion of another quantity or amount or measure
191.occupancy rate: the percentage of all rental units (as in hotels) are occupied or rented at a given time
191.batting average: (an extension of the baseball term) the proportion of times some effort succeeds
191.absentee rate: the percentage of workers who do not report to work

721.oboe da caccia: an alto oboe; precursor of the English horn
721.contrabassoon: the bassoon that is the largest instrument in the oboe family
721.bombardon: a large shawm; the bass member of the shawm family
721.double-reed instrument: a woodwind that has a pair of joined reeds that vibrate together
721.heckelphone: an oboe pitched an octave below the ordinary oboe
721.bassoon: a double-reed instrument; the tenor of the oboe family
721.tenoroon: a tenor bassoon; pitched a fifth higher than the ordinary bassoon
721.oboe: a slender double-reed instrument; a woodwind with a conical bore and a double-reed mouthpiece
721.oboe d'amore: an oboe pitched a minor third lower than the ordinary oboe; used to perform baroque music
721.krummhorn: a Renaissance woodwind with a double reed and a curving tube (crooked horn)
721.English horn: a double-reed woodwind instrument similar to an oboe but lower in pitch

606.nympholepsy: a frenzy of emotion; as for something unattainable
606.affective disorder: any mental disorder not caused by detectable organic abnormalities of the brain and in which a major disturbance of emotions is predominant
606.unipolar depression: a major depressive episode that occurs without the manic phase that occurs in the classic form of bipolar disorder
606.neurotic depression: a term used for any state of depression that is not psychotic
606.major depressive episode: (psychiatry) a state of depression with all the classic symptoms (anhedonia and lethargy and sleep disturbance and despondency and morbid thoughts and feelings of worthlessness and sometimes attempted suicide) but with no known organic dysfunction
606.depressive disorder: a state of depression and anhedonia so severe as to require clinical intervention
606.exogenous depression: an inappropriate state of depression that is precipitated by events in the person's life (to be distinguished from normal grief)
606.endogenous depression: a state of depression for which there is no apparent precipitating cause
606.retarded depression: a state of clinical depression in which the individual is lethargic and slow to initiate action
606.bipolar disorder: a mental disorder characterized by episodes of mania and depression
606.cyclothymia: a mild bipolar disorder that persists over a long time
606.psychotic depression: a state of depression so severe that the person loses contact with reality and suffers a variety of functional impairments
606.agitated depression: a state of clinical depression in which the person exhibits irritability and restlessness
606.involutional depression: a major depressive episode associated with the climacteric
606.mass hysteria: a condition in which a large group of people exhibit the same state of violent mental agitation
606.mania: a mood disorder; an affective disorder in which the victim tends to respond excessively and sometimes violently
606.anaclitic depression: severe and progressive depression in infants who lose their mother and do not get a suitable substitute

269.rondo: a musical form that is often the last movement of a sonata
269.concerto grosso: a baroque composition for orchestra and a group of solo instruments
269.concerto: a composition for orchestra and a soloist
269.comic opera: opera with a happy ending and in which some of the text is spoken
269.musical drama: opera in which the musical and dramatic elements are equally important; the music is appropriate to the action
269.classical music: traditional genre of music conforming to an established form and appealing to critical interest and developed musical taste
269.cantata: a musical composition for voices and orchestra based on a religious text
269.grand opera: opera in which all the text is sung
269.sonata: a musical composition of 3 or 4 movements of contrasting forms
269.opera: a drama set to music; consists of singing with orchestral accompaniment and an orchestral overture and interludes
269.symphony: a long and complex sonata for symphony orchestra
269.fugue: a musical form consisting of a theme repeated a fifth above or a fourth below its first statement

269.chamber music: serious music performed by a small group of musicians

701.malt: a cereal grain (usually barley) that is kiln-dried after having been germinated by soaking in water; used especially in brewing and distilling

701.popcorn: small kernels of corn exploded by heat
701.corn: ears of corn that can be prepared and served for human food

736.cadence: the close of a musical section

736.largo: (music) a composition or passage that is to be performed in a slow and dignified manner
736.arioso: (music) a short recitative that is melodic but is not an aria
736.recitative: a vocal passage of narrative text that a singer delivers with natural rhythms of speech
736.impromptu: a short musical passage that seems to have been made spontaneously without advance preparation
736.plagal cadence: a cadence (frequently ending church music) in which the chord of the subdominant precedes the chord of the tonic
736.allegro: a musical composition or musical passage to be performed quickly in a brisk lively manner
736.passage: a short section of a musical composition
736.intro: a brief introductory passage to a piece of popular music
736.cadenza: a brilliant solo passage occurring near the end of a piece of music
736.transition: a musical passage moving from one key to another
736.ostinato: a musical phrase repeated over and over during a composition
736.andante: a musical composition or musical passage to be performed moderately slow
736.ground bass: a short melody in the bass that is constantly repeated
736.adagio: (music) a composition played in adagio tempo (slowly and gracefully)
736.riff: a jazz ostinato; usually provides a background for a solo improvisation
736.ligature: (music) a group of notes connected by a slur

204.beta-hydroxybutyric acid: beta derivative of hydroxybutyric acid that is found in the blood and urine in some cases of impaired metabolism

204.caprylic acid: a fatty acid having a rancid taste; found in butter and other fats and oils

45.instability: the quality or attribute of being unstable and irresolute
45.ruggedness: the quality of being topologically uneven
45.rockiness: the quality of abounding in rocks and stones
45.spasticity: the quality of moving or acting in spasms
45.randomness: the quality of lacking any predictable order or plan

45.jaggedness: something irregular like a bump or crack in a smooth surface

45.shakiness: the quality of being unstable and insecure

759.ski run: trail or slope prepared for skiing
759.cattle trail: a trail over which cattle were driven to market

218.alpha-interferon: a form of interferon that is produced endogenously and commercially for its pharmacological effects (including regulation of the immune system and antiviral and antineoplastic effects)
218.nucleoside reverse transcriptase inhibit: an antiviral drug used against HIV; is incorporated into the DNA of the virus and stops the building process; results in incomplete DNA that cannot create a new virus; often used in combination with other drugs
218.beta-interferon: a form of interferon that is produced by fibroblasts and have antiviral effects; used in the treatment of multiple sclerosis
218.reverse transcriptase inhibitor: an antiviral drug that inhibits the action of reverse transcriptase in retroviruses such as HIV
218.ribavirin: an inhaled antiviral agent (trade name Virazole) that may be used to treat serious virus infections
218.dideoxyinosine: an antiviral drug used to combat HIV infection
218.protease inhibitor: an antiviral drug used against HIV; interrupts HIV replication by binding and blocking HIV protease; often used in combination with other drugs
218.gamma-interferon: a form of interferon that is produced by T cells and macrophages; involved in the activation of phagocytes
218.interferon: an antiviral protein produced by cells that have been invaded by a virus; inhibits replication of the virus
218.nelfinavir: a protease inhibitor (trade name Viracept) used in treating HIV usually in combination with other drugs
218.dideoxycytosine: an antiviral drug used to combat HIV infection
218.ritonavir: a protease inhibitor (trade name Norvir) used in treating HIV
218.saquinavir: a weak protease inhibitor (trade name Invirase) used in treating HIV
218.nevirapine: a non-nucleoside reverse transcriptase inhibitor (trade name Viramune) used to treat AIDS and HIV
218.non-nucleoside reverse transcriptase inh: an antiviral drug used against HIV; binds directly to reverse transcriptase and prevents RNA conversion to DNA; often used in combination with other drugs
218.delavirdine: a non-nucleoside reverse transcriptase inhibitor (trade name Rescriptor) used to treat AIDS and HIV
218.lamivudine: a nucleoside reverse transcriptase inhibitor that is very effective in combination with zidovudine in treating AIDS and HIV
218.indinavir: a protease inhibitor (trade name Crixivan) used for treating HIV
218.zidovudine: an antiviral drug (trade name Retrovir) used in the treatment of AIDS; adverse side effects include liver damage and suppression of the bone marrow

289.sunburst pleat: knife pleat cut on the bias to produce a flared effect

455.pertness: quality of being lively and confident

374.Sunni: one of the two main branches of orthodox Islam

374.brethren: (plural) the lay members of a male religious order

374.Shiah: one of the two main branches of orthodox Islam; mainly in Iran

374.Augustinian order: any of several monastic orders observing a rule derived from the writings of St. Augustine

374.Kokka Shinto: the branch of Shinto recognized as the official state religion of Japan
374.Augustinian Hermits: a monastic order of friars established in 1256 by the Pope

94.consumer credit: a line of credit extended for personal or household use
94.overdraft credit: credit provided by a bank in honoring a customer's overdrafts
94.credit card: a card (usually plastic) that assures a seller that the person using it has a satisfactory credit rating and that the issuer will see to it that the seller receives payment for the merchandise delivered
94.bank card: a credit card issued by a bank

94.cash card: a credit card that entitles the holder to receive cash
94.calling card: a card that is used instead of cash to make telephone calls
94.credit account: credit extended by a business to a customer
94.installment credit: a loan repaid with interest in equal periodic payments
94.home loan: a loan secured by equity value in the borrower's home
94.open-end credit: a consumer credit line that can be used up to a certain limit or paid down at any time
94.revolving charge account: a charge account that does not have to be paid to zero balance
94.smart card: a plastic card containing a microprocessor that enables the holder to perform operations requiring data that is stored in the microprocessor; typically used to perform financial transactions

371.stringybark pine: Australian cypress pine with fibrous inner bark

371.Bermuda cedar: ornamental densely pyramidal juniper of Bermuda; fairly large for a juniper
