371.southern red cedar: juniper of swampy coastal regions of southeastern United States; similar to eastern red cedar
371.Ahuehuete: Mexico's most famous tree; a giant specimen of Montezuma cypress more than 2,000 years old with a girth of 165 feet at Santa Maria del Tule
371.ground cedar: a procumbent variety of the common juniper
371.Mexican juniper: small tree of western Texas and mountains of Mexico having spreading branches with drooping branchlets
371.black cypress pine: Australian tree with small flattened scales as leaves and numerous dark brown seed; valued for its timber and resin
371.bald cypress: common cypress of southeastern United States having trunk expanded at base; found in coastal swamps and flooding river bottoms
371.sequoia: either of two huge coniferous California trees that reach a height of 300 feet; sometimes placed in the Taxodiaceae
371.Montezuma cypress: cypress of river valleys of Mexican highlands
371.giant sequoia: extremely lofty evergreen of southern end of western foothills of Sierra Nevada in California; largest living organism
371.east African cedar: tropical African timber tree with fragrant wood

453.cinema verite: a movie that shows ordinary people in actual activities without being controlled by a director
453.coming attraction: a movie that is advertised to draw customers
453.documentary: a film or TV program presenting the facts about a person or event
453.talking picture: a movie with synchronized speech and singing
453.telefilm: a movie that is made to be shown on television
453.Western: a film about life in the western United States during the period of exploration and development
453.cartoon: a film made by photographing a series of cartoon drawings to give the illusion of movement when projected in rapid sequence
453.feature: the principal (full-length) film in a program at a movie theater
453.three-D: a movie with images having three dimensional form or appearance
453.film noir: a movie that is marked by a mood of pessimism, fatalism, menace, and cynical characters
453.final cut: the final edited version of a movie as approved by the director and producer
453.newsreel: a short film and commentary about current events
453.slow motion: a movie that apparently takes place at a slower than normal speed; achieved by taking the film at a faster rate
453.rough cut: the first print of a movie after preliminary editing
453.movie: a form of entertainment that enacts a story by sound and a sequence of images giving the illusion of continuous movement
453.collage film: a movie that juxtaposes different kinds of footage
453.home movie: a film made at home by an amateur photographer
453.musical: a play or film whose action and dialogue is interspersed with singing and dancing
453.peepshow: a short pornographic film shown in a small coin-operated booth
453.spaghetti Western: a low-budget Western movie produced by a European (especially an Italian) film company
453.short subject: a brief film; often shown prior to showing the feature
453.shoot-'em-up: a movie featuring shooting and violence

205.dacite: a grey volcanic rock containing plagioclase and quartz and other crystalline minerals
205.volcanic glass: a kind of natural glass produced when molten lava cools very rapidly
205.groundmass: (geology) the matrix of fine-grained crystalline material in which larger crystals are embedded
205.lava: rock that in its molten form (as magma) issues from volcanos; lava is what magma is called when it reaches the surface
205.tuff: hard volcanic rock composed of compacted volcanic ash
205.aplite: light-colored and fine-grained granitic rock consisting chiefly of quartz and feldspars
205.granite: plutonic igneous rock having visibly crystalline texture; generally composed of feldspar and mica and quartz
205.basalt: the commonest type of solidified lava; a dense dark grey fine-grained igneous rock that is composed chiefly of plagioclase feldspar and pyroxene
205.amygdaloid: volcanic rock in which rounded cavities formed by expanding gas have subsequently become filled with mineral deposits
205.volcanic rock: extrusive igneous rock solidified near or on the surface of the Earth
205.kimberlite: a rare type of peridotite that sometimes contains diamonds; found in South Africa and Siberia
205.aa: a dry form of lava resembling clinkers
205.batholith: large mass of intrusive igneous rock believed to have solidified deep within the earth
205.gabbro: one of a family of granular intrusive rocks
205.pegmatite: a form of igneous rock consisting of extremely coarse granite resulting from the crystallization of magma rich in rare elements
205.peridotite: a dark coarse-grained igneous rock consisting principally of olivine
205.igneous rock: rock formed by the solidification of molten magma
205.pillow lava: lava that hardened in rounded shapes suggestive of pillows; believed to result from underwater eruptions
205.agglomerate: volcanic rock consisting of large fragments fused together
205.obsidian: acid or granitic glass formed by the rapid cooling of lava without crystallization; usually dark, but transparent in thin pieces
205.porphyry: any igneous rock with crystals embedded in a finer groundmass of minerals

13.drag coefficient: the ratio of the drag on a body moving through air to the product of the velocity and the surface area of the body
13.coefficient of reflection: the fraction of radiant energy that is reflected from a surface
13.coefficient of elasticity: (physics) the ratio of the applied stress to the change in shape of an elastic body
13.Young's modulus: a coefficient of elasticity applicable to the stretching of a wire
13.bulk modulus: the ratio of the change in pressure acting on a volume to the fractional change in volume
13.coefficient of self induction: the ratio of the electromotive force produced in a circuit by self-induction to the rate of change of current producing it, expressed in henries
13.coefficient of mutual induction: a measure of the induction between two circuits; the ratio of the electromotive force in a circuit to the corresponding change of current in a neighboring circuit; usually measured in henries
13.coefficient of friction: the ratio of the weight of an object being moved along a surface and the force that maintains contact between the object and the surface
13.modulus of rigidity: the coefficient of elasticity for a shearing force
13.weight: (statistics) a coefficient assigned to elements of a frequency distribution in order to represent their relative importance
13.coefficient: a constant number that serves as a measure of some property or characteristic
13.absorption coefficient: a measure of the rate of decrease in the intensity of electromagnetic radiation (as light) as it passes through a given substance; the fraction of incident radiant energy absorbed per unit mass or thickness of an absorber
13.coefficient of viscosity: a measure of the resistance to flow of a fluid under an applied force
13.transmittance: the fraction of radiant energy that passes through a substance
13.modulus: (physics) a coefficient that expresses how much of a specified property is possessed by a specified substance
13.coefficient of expansion: the fractional change in length or area or volume per unit change in temperature at a given constant pressure

421.sublingual gland: a small salivary gland that produces mucin (the viscous component of saliva); in human beings it is located on either side of the mouth under the tongue
421.Cowper's gland: either of two glands that discharge a component of seminal fluid into the urethra; homologous to Bartholin's gland in the female
421.cervical glands: mucus-secreting glands in the mucosa of the uterine cervix
421.Montgomery's tubercle: one of the sebaceous glands on the areolae of the breast that lubricate the breast during breast-feeding
421.apocrine gland: a large sweat gland that produces both a fluid and an apocrine secretion; in human beings located in hairy regions of the body
421.lacrimal gland: any of the glands in the eyes that secrete tears
421.udder: mammary gland of bovids (cows and sheep and goats)
421.seminal vesicle: either of a pair of glands located on either side of the male urinary bladder that open into the vas deferens and that secrete many components of semen during ejaculation
421.sweat gland: any of the glands in the skin that secrete perspiration
421.parotid gland: a large salivary gland that produces 50% of daytime saliva; in human beings it is located in front of and below each ear
421.Meibomian gland: a long sebaceous gland that lubricates the eyelids
421.vestibular gland: a gland that opens into the vestibule of the vagina; secretions lubricate the vagina during coitus
421.breast: either of two soft fleshy milk-secreting glandular organs on the chest of a woman
421.submaxillary gland: a salivary gland inside the lower jaw on either side that produces most of the nocturnal saliva; discharges saliva into the mouth under the tongue
421.Bartholin's gland: either of the two posterior vestibular glands that secrete a lubricating mucus; homologous to Cowper's gland in the male
421.eccrine gland: a small sweat gland that produces only a fluid; restricted to the human skin
421.pancreas: a large elongated exocrine gland located behind the stomach; secretes pancreatic juice and insulin
421.digestive gland: any gland having ducts that pour secretions into the digestive tract
421.nabothian gland: one of many small glands of the uterine cervix that secrete mucus
421.dug: an udder or breast or teat
421.salivary gland: any of three pairs of glands in the mouth and digestive system that secrete saliva for digestion
421.exocrine gland: a gland that secretes externally through a duct
421.uropygial gland: oil-secreting gland situated at the base of the tail in most birds
421.sebaceous gland: a cutaneous gland that secretes sebum (usually into a hair follicle) for lubricating hair and skin

536.venesection: surgical incision into a vein; used to treat hemochromatosis
536.incision: the cutting of or into body tissues or organs (especially by a surgeon as part of an operation)
536.episiotomy: surgical incision of the perineum to enlarge the vagina and so facilitate delivery during childbirth
536.thoracotomy: surgical incision into the chest walls opening up the pleural cavity
536.cut: the act of penetrating or opening open with a sharp edge
536.nephrotomy: incision into a kidney (usually to remove a kidney stone)
536.vasotomy: surgical incision into or division of the vas deferens
536.sclerotomy: surgical incision of the sclerotic coat of the eye
536.orchotomy: surgical incision into the testis to obtain material for analysis (as in cases of abnormally low sperm count)
536.laparoscopy: laparotomy performed with a laparoscope that makes a small incision to examine the abdominal cavity (especially the ovaries and Fallopian tubes)
536.laparotomy: surgical incision into the abdominal wall; often done to examine abdominal organs
536.slash: a strong sweeping cut made with a sharp instrument
536.valvotomy: incision into a stenosed cardiac valve to relieve the obstruction

416.navy: an organization of military vessels belonging to a country and available for sea warfare
416.Marines: members of a body of troops trained to serve on land or at sea
416.United States Coast Guard: an agency of the Department of Transportation responsible for patrolling shores and facilitating nautical commerce
416.Union Army: the northern army during the American Civil War
416.coastguard: a military service responsible for the safety of maritime traffic in coastal waters
416.Continental Army: the American army during the American Revolution
416.standing army: a permanent army of paid soldiers
416.army: a permanent organization of the military land forces of a nation or state
416.Sabaoth: (plural) hosts or armies; used in the book of Romans in the New Testament
416.air force: the airborne branch of a country's armed forces
416.military service: a force that is a branch of the armed forces
416.Air Corps: formerly the airborne division of the United States Army
416.Confederate Army: the southern army during the American Civil War
416.Roman Legion: a division of from 3000 to 6000 men (including cavalry) in the Roman army
416.United States Marine Corps: an amphibious division of the United States Navy

427.blues: a type of folksong that originated among Black Americans at the beginning of the 20th century; has a melancholy sound from repeated use of blue notes
427.schottische: music performed for dancing the schottische
427.zydeco: music of southern Louisiana that combines French dance melodies with Caribbean music and blues
427.doo-wop: a genre (usually a cappella) of Black vocal-harmony music of the 1950s that evolved in New York City from gospel singing; characterized by close four-part harmonies; the name derived from some of the nonsense syllables sung by the backup
427.hillbilly music: country music originating in mountainous regions of southern United States
427.gospel: folk music consisting of a genre of a cappella music originating with Black slaves in the United States and featuring call and response; influential on the development of other genres of popular music (especially soul)
427.boogie: an instrumental version of the blues (especially for piano)
427.soul: a secular form of gospel that was a major Black musical genre in the 1960s and 1970s
427.folk song: a song that is traditionally sung by the common people of a region and forms part of their culture
427.bluegrass: a type of country music played at a rapid tempo on banjos and guitars
427.folk music: the traditional and typically anonymous music that is an expression of the life of people in a community
427.country music: a simple style of folk music heard mostly in the southern United States; usually played on stringed instruments

695.nosedive: a sudden sharp drop or rapid decline
695.ebb: a gradual decline (in size or strength or power or number)
695.slump: a noticeable deterioration in performance or quality
695.detumescence: diminution of swelling; the subsidence of anything swollen
695.epilation: loss of hair; the result of removing hair
695.sinking spell: a temporary decline in health or value
695.deterioration: process of changing to an inferior state
695.reducing: loss of excess weight (as by dieting); becoming slimmer
695.decline: change toward something smaller or lower
695.slippage: decline from a standard level of performance or achievement
695.loss: gradual decline in amount or activity

634.rail technology: the activity of designing and constructing and operating railroads
634.aeronautical engineering: the activity of designing and constructing aircraft
634.technology: the practical application of science to commerce or industry
634.chemical engineering: the activity of applying chemistry to the solution of practical problems
634.communications technology: the activity of designing and constructing and maintaining communication systems
634.digital communications technology: the design and construction of communications technology that transmits information in digital form
634.computer technology: the activity of designing and constructing and programming computers
634.automation: the act of implementing the control of equipment with advanced technology; usually involving electronic hardware
634.magnetic levitation: high-speed rail technology; train is suspended on a magnetic cushion above a magnetized track and so travels free of friction
634.automotive technology: the activity of designing and constructing automobiles
634.high technology: highly advanced technological development (especially in electronics)
634.computerization: the control of processes by computer

712.attachment: a writ authorizing the seizure of property that may be needed for the payment of a judgment in a judicial proceeding
712.assize: an ancient writ issued by a court of assize to the sheriff for the recovery of property
712.interdict: a court order prohibiting a party from doing a certain activity
712.subpoena: a writ issued by court authority to compel the attendance of a witness at a judicial proceeding; disobedience may be punishable as a contempt of court
712.pickup: a warrant to take someone into custody
712.monition: a summons issued after the filing of a libel or claim directing all parties concerned to show cause why the judgment asked for should not be granted
712.writ: (law) a legal document issued by a court or judicial officer
712.pardon: a warrant granting release from punishment for an offense
712.writ of error: a judicial writ from an appellate court ordering the court of record to produce the records of trial
712.scire facias: a judicial writ based on some record and requiring the party against whom it is brought to show cause why the record should not be enforced or annulled
712.summons: a writ issued by authority of law; usually compels the defendant's attendance in a civil suit; failure to appear results in a default judgment against the defendant
712.garnishment: a court order to an employer to withhold all or part of an employee's wages and to send the money to the court or to the person who won a lawsuit against the employee
712.execution: a routine court order that attempts to enforce the judgment that has been granted to a plaintiff by authorizing a sheriff to carry it out
712.gag order: a court order restricting information or comment by the participants involved in a lawsuit
712.cachet: a warrant formerly issued by a French king who could warrant imprisonment or death in a signed letter under his seal
712.writ of prohibition: a judicial writ from a higher court ordering a lower court not to exercise jurisdiction in a particular case
712.speeding ticket: a ticket issued for driving above the speed limit
712.mandamus: an extraordinary writ commanding an official to perform a ministerial act that the law recognizes as an absolute duty and not a matter for the official's discretion; used only when all other judicial remedies fail
712.reprieve: a warrant granting postponement (usually to postpone the execution of the death sentence)
712.venire facias: a judicial writ ordering a sheriff to summon people for jury duty
712.subpoena duces tecum: a writ issued by a court at the request of one of the parties to a suit; it requires a witness to bring to court or to a deposition any relevant documents under the witness's control
712.bench warrant: a warrant authorizing law enforcement officials to apprehend an offender and bring that person to court
712.habeas corpus: a writ ordering a prisoner to be brought before a judge
712.certiorari: a common law writ issued by a superior court to one of inferior jurisdiction demanding the record of a particular case
712.parking ticket: a ticket issued for parking in a restricted place
712.sequestration: a writ that authorizes the seizure of property
712.court order: a writ issued by a court of law requiring a person to do something or to refrain from doing something
712.death warrant: a warrant to execute the death sentence
712.divestiture: an order to an offending party to rid itself of property; it has the purpose of depriving the defendant of the gains of wrongful behavior
712.fieri facias: a writ ordering a levy on the belongings of a debtor to satisfy the debt
712.warrant: a writ from a court commanding police to perform specified acts
712.search warrant: a warrant authorizing law enforcement officials to search for objects or people involved in the commission of a crime and to produce them in court; the warrant describes the locations where the officials may search
712.writ of right: a writ ordering that land be restored to its rightful owner
712.writ of detinue: a writ ordering the release of goods that have been unlawfully detained
712.citation: a summons that commands the appearance of a party at a proceeding
712.commutation: a warrant substituting a lesser punishment for a greater one
712.writ of election: a writ ordering the holding of an election
712.ticket: a summons issued to an offender (especially to someone who violates a traffic regulation)

348.lambrequin: a scarf that covers a knight's helmet
348.fichu: a lightweight triangular scarf worn by a woman
348.stole: a wide scarf worn about their shoulders by women
348.patka: a scarf worn by Sikh men
348.muffler: a scarf worn around the neck
348.rebozo: a long woolen or linen scarf covering the head and shoulders (also used as a sling for holding a baby); traditionally worn by Latin-American women
348.kerchief: a square scarf that is folded into a triangle and worn over the head or about the neck
348.mantilla: a woman's silk or lace scarf
348.sable: a scarf (or trimming) made of sable
348.neckerchief: a kerchief worn around the neck
348.feather boa: a long thin fluffy scarf of feathers or fur
348.scarf: a garment worn around the head or neck or shoulders for warmth or decoration
348.khimar: a headscarf worn by observant Muslim women that hangs down to just above the waist
348.headscarf: a kerchief worn over the head and tied under the chin
348.hijab: a headscarf worn by Muslim women; conceals the hair and neck and usually has a face veil that covers the face
348.tudung: a scarf worn around the head by Muslim women in Malaysia; conceals the hair but not the face
348.babushka: a woman's headscarf folded into a triangle and tied under the chin; worn by Russian peasant women

187.gambrel: a gable roof with two slopes on each side and the lower slope being steeper
187.sunroof: an automobile roof having a sliding or raisable panel
187.mansard: a hip roof having two slopes on each side
187.French roof: a mansard roof with sides that are nearly perpendicular
187.groined vault: two barrel vaults intersecting at right angles
187.gable roof: a double sloping roof with a ridge and gables at each end
187.barrel vault: the simplest form of vault; a single continuous arch
187.tile roof: a roof made of fired clay tiles
187.roof: a protective covering that covers or forms the top of a building
187.geodesic dome: a lightweight dome constructed of interlocking polygons; invented by R. Buckminster Fuller
187.hip roof: a roof having sloping ends as well as sloping sides
187.whispering gallery: a space beneath a dome or arch in which sounds produced at certain points are clearly audible at certain distant points
187.vault: an arched brick or stone ceiling or roof
187.thatch: a house roof made with a plant material (as straw)
187.pressure dome: a dome-shaped building that is pressurized
187.ribbed vault: vault that resembles a groined vault but has ribbed arches
187.astrodome: a transparent dome on top of an airplane where the navigator can make celestial observations
187.curb roof: a roof with two or more slopes on each side of the ridge
187.onion dome: a dome that is shaped like a bulb; characteristic of Russian and Byzantine church architecture
187.cupola: a roof in the form of a dome

323.zodiac: (astrology) a circular diagram representing the 12 zodiacal constellations and showing their signs
323.block diagram: a diagram showing the interconnections between the components of system (especially an electronic system)
323.vignette: a small illustrative sketch (as sometimes placed at the beginning of chapters in books)
323.draft: a preliminary sketch of a design or picture
323.Venn diagram: a diagram that uses circles to represent mathematical or logical sets pictorially inside a rectangle (the universal set); elements that are common to more than one set are represented by intersections of the circles
323.silverpoint: a drawing made on specially prepared paper with an instrument having a silver tip (15th and 16th centuries)
323.vertical section: a mechanical drawing showing the interior of an object as if made by a vertical plane passing through it
323.wiring diagram: a schematic drawing of the wiring of an electrical system
323.horizontal section: a mechanical drawing of an object as if made by a plane cutting through it horizontally
323.rendering: perspective drawing of an architect's design
323.schematic: diagram of an electrical or mechanical system
323.floor plan: scale drawing of a horizontal section through a building at a given level; contrasts with elevation
323.mechanical drawing: scale drawing of a machine or architectural plan etc,
323.silhouette: a drawing of the outline of an object; filled in with some uniform color
323.charcoal: a drawing made with a stick of black carbon material
323.horoscope: a diagram of the positions of the planets and signs of the zodiac at a particular time and place
323.design: a preliminary sketch indicating the plan for something
323.ground plan: a floor plan for the ground level of a building
323.diagram: a drawing intended to explain how something works; a drawing showing the relation between the parts
323.drawing: a representation of forms or objects on a surface by means of lines
323.animalization: a depiction in the form of an animal
323.stick figure: drawing of a human or animal that represents the head by a circle and the rest of the body by straight lines
323.elevation: drawing of an exterior of a structure
323.pen-and-ink: a drawing executed with pen and ink
323.delineation: a drawing of the outlines of forms or objects
323.tracing: a drawing created by superimposing a semitransparent sheet of paper on the original image and copying on it the lines of the original image

200.fob: a vest pocket to hold a pocket watch
200.waist pack: a small pouch (usually with a zipper) that attaches to a belt and is worn around the waist
200.fanny pack: a waist pack worn with the pouch in back
200.pocket: a small pouch inside a garment for carrying small articles
200.mailbag: pouch used in the shipment of mail
200.hip pocket: a pocket in rear of trousers
200.patch pocket: a flat pocket sewn to the outside of a garment
200.slash pocket: a pocket in a garment (usually below the waist) to which access is provided by a vertical or diagonal slit in the outside of the garment
200.diplomatic pouch: a mail pouch that is sealed shut and that is used to carry communications between a legation and its home office
200.breast pocket: a pocket inside of a man's coat
200.vest pocket: a small pocket in a man's vest
200.pouch: a small or medium size container for holding or carrying things
200.sporran: a fur or leather pouch worn at the front of the kilt as part of the traditional dress of Scottish Highlanders
200.tobacco pouch: a pouch for carrying pipe tobacco

682.Acheson process: an industrial process for making graphite by heating a mixture of coke and clay
682.industrial process: a systematic series of mechanical or chemical operations that produce or manufacture something
682.carbonization: the destructive distillation of coal (as in coke ovens)
682.Solvay process: an industrial process for producing sodium carbonate from sodium chloride and ammonia and carbon dioxide
682.Haber process: an industrial process for producing ammonia from nitrogen and hydrogen by combining them under high pressure in the presence of an iron catalyst
682.electrostatic precipitation: a process that removes suspended dust particles from a gas by applying a high voltage electrostatic charge to the particles and collecting them on charged plates
682.fractional distillation: fractionation of a liquid by distillation
682.destructive distillation: heating a solid substance in a closed container and collecting the volatile products
682.Bessemer process: an industrial process for making steel using a Bessemer converter to blast air through molten iron and thus burning the excess carbon and impurities; the first successful method of making steel in quantity at low cost
682.fractionation: a process that uses heat to separate a substance into its components
682.cyanide process: an industrial process for extracting gold and silver by treating ore with a sodium cyanide solution

661.abacus: a calculator that performs arithmetic functions by manually sliding counters on rods or in grooves
661.pulse counter: an electronic counter that counts the number of electric pulses
661.calculator: a small machine that is used for mathematical calculations
661.adding machine: a calculator that performs simple arithmetic functions
661.hand calculator: a calculator small enough to hold in the hand or carry in a pocket
661.scaler: an electronic pulse counter used to count pulses that occur too rapidly to be recorded individually
661.counter: a calculator that keeps a record of the number of times something happens
661.quipu: calculator consisting of a cord with attached cords; used by ancient Peruvians for calculating and keeping records
661.Napier's bones: a set of graduated rods formerly used to do multiplication and division by a method invented by John Napier

117.depository financial institution: a financial institution that accepts deposits and channels the money into lending activities
117.thrift institution: a depository financial institution intended to encourage personal savings and home buying
117.Home Loan Bank: one of 11 regional banks that monitor and make short-term credit advances to thrift institutions in their region
117.state bank: a bank chartered by a state rather than by the federal government
117.acquirer: a corporation gaining financial control over another corporation or financial institution through a payment in cash or an exchange of stock
117.credit union: a cooperative depository financial institution whose members can obtain loans from their combined savings
117.national bank: a commercial bank chartered by the federal government
117.commercial bank: a financial institution that accepts demand deposits and makes loans and provides other services for the public
117.member bank: a bank that is a member of the Federal Reserve System
117.merchant bank: a credit card processing bank; merchants receive credit for credit card receipts less a processing fee
117.savings bank: a thrift institution in the northeastern United States; since deregulation in the 1980s they offer services competitive with many commercial banks
117.mutual savings bank: a state-chartered savings bank owned by its depositors and managed by a board of trustees
117.agent bank: a bank that acts as an agent for a foreign bank
117.savings and loan: a thrift institution that is required by law to make a certain percentage of its loans as home mortgages
117.building society: British equivalent of United States savings and loan association
117.Federal Reserve Bank: one of 12 regional banks that monitor and act as depositories for banks in their region
117.lead bank: a bank named by a lending syndicate of several banks to protect their interests

63.basal body temperature: body temperature in the morning before rising or moving about or eating anything
63.body temperature: temperature of the body; normally 98.6 F or 37 C in humans; usually measured to obtain a quick evaluation of a person's health
63.respiratory rate: the rate at which a person inhales and exhales; usually measured to obtain a quick evaluation of a person's health
63.arterial pressure: the pressure of the circulating blood on the arteries
63.femoral pulse: pulse of the femoral artery (felt in the groin)
63.systolic pressure: the blood pressure (as measured by a sphygmomanometer) during the contraction of the left ventricle of the heart
63.radial pulse: pulse of the radial artery (felt in the wrist)
63.vital sign: sign of life; usually an indicator of a person's general physical condition
63.venous pressure: the pressure exerted on the walls of the veins by the circulating blood
63.diastolic pressure: the blood pressure (as measured by a sphygmomanometer) after the contraction of the heart while the chambers of the heart refill with blood
63.sign: (medicine) any objective evidence of the presence of a disorder or disease
63.blood pressure: the pressure of the circulating blood against the walls of the blood vessels; results from the systole of the left ventricle of the heart; sometimes measured for a quick evaluation of a person's health
63.pulse: the rate at which the heart beats; usually measured to obtain a quick evaluation of a person's health

729.foundling: a child who has been abandoned and whose parents are unknown
729.postmature infant: infant born after 42 weeks of gestation; usually shows signs of placental insufficiency
729.test-tube baby: a baby conceived by fertilization that occurs outside the mother's body; the woman's ova are removed and mixed with sperm in a culture medium - if fertilization occurs the blastocyte is implanted in the woman's uterus
729.term infant: infant born at a gestational age between 37 and 42 completed weeks
729.stepdaughter: a daughter of your spouse by a former marriage
729.liveborn infant: infant who shows signs of life after birth
729.baby: a very young child (birth to 1 year) who has not yet begun to walk or talk
729.stepchild: a child of your spouse by a former marriage
729.Junior: a son who has the same first name as his father
729.army brat: the child of a career officer of the United States Army
729.low-birth-weight baby: an infant born weighing less than 5.5 pounds (2500 grams) regardless of gestational age
729.stepson: the son your spouse by a former marriage
729.premature baby: an infant that is born prior to 37 weeks of gestation
729.neonate: a baby from birth to four weeks
729.mother's boy: a boy excessively attached to his mother; lacking normal masculine interests
729.small-for-gestational-age infant: an infant whose size and weight are considerably less than the average for babies of the same age
729.mother's daughter: a daughter who is favored by and similar to her mother
729.nursling: an infant considered in relation to its nurse
729.child: a human offspring (son or daughter) of any age
729.blue baby: an infant born with a bluish color; usually has a defective heart
729.Esau: (Old Testament) the eldest son of Isaac who would have inherited the covenant that God made with Abraham and that Abraham passed on to Isaac; he traded his birthright to his twin brother Jacob for a mess of pottage
729.godchild: an infant who is sponsored by an adult (the godparent) at baptism
729.stillborn infant: infant who shows no signs of life after birth

86.river dolphin: any of several long-snouted usually freshwater dolphins of South America and southern Asia
86.pilot whale: small dark-colored whale of the Atlantic coast of the United States; the largest male acts as pilot or leader for the school
86.porpoise: any of several small gregarious cetacean mammals having a blunt snout and many teeth
86.grampus: slaty-grey blunt-nosed dolphin common in northern seas
86.toothed whale: any of several whales having simple conical teeth and feeding on fish etc.

201.professionalism: the expertness characteristic of a professional person

450.shortening: fat such as butter or lard used in baked goods

8.promenade: a square dance figure; couples march counterclockwise in a circle

27.penis envy: (psychoanalysis) a female's presumed envy of the male's penis; said to explain femininity

387.impression: an impressionistic portrayal of a person

99.box: a (usually rectangular) container; may have a lid

99.strongbox: a strongly made box for holding money or valuables; can be locked

633.line of duty: all that is normally required in some area of responsibility

504.impact: the striking of one body against another

487.fornix: an arched bundle of white fibers at the base of the brain by which the hippocampus of each hemisphere projects to the contralateral hippocampus and to the thalamus and mamillary bodies
487.coccygeal nerve: the lowest pair of spinal nerves
487.ulnar nerve: a nerve running along the inner side of the arm and passing near the elbow; supplies intrinsic muscles of the hand and the skin of the medial side of the hand
487.dorsal root: one of the two roots of a spinal nerve that passes dorsally to the spinal cord and that consists of sensory fibers
487.splanchnic nerve: any of several nerves of the sympathetic part of the autonomic nervous system that innervate viscera and blood vessels
487.thoracic nerve: any of twelve pairs of spinal nerves emerging from the thoracic region of the spinal cord
487.facial: cranial nerve that supplies facial muscles
487.glossopharyngeal nerve: sensory nerve to the pharynx and back of the tongue; motor fibers innervate muscles that elevate the pharynx and larynx; includes parasympathetic fibers to the otic ganglion
487.oculomotor: supplies extrinsic muscles of the eye
487.pyramidal tract: any of the important motor nerves on each side of the central nervous system that run from the sensorimotor areas of the cortex through the brainstem to motor neurons of the cranial nerve nuclei and the ventral root of the spinal cord
487.abducent: a small motor nerve supplying the lateral rectus muscle of the eye
487.vagus: a mixed nerve that supplies the pharynx and larynx and lungs and heart and esophagus and stomach and most of the abdominal viscera
487.acoustic nerve: a composite sensory nerve supplying the hair cells of the vestibular organ and the hair cells of the cochlea
487.sensory nerve: a nerve that passes impulses from receptors toward or to the central nervous system
487.trigeminal: the main sensory nerve of the face and motor nerve for the muscles of mastication
487.olfactory nerve: a collective term for numerous olfactory filaments in the nasal mucosa
487.sacral nerve: any of five pairs of spinal nerves emerging from the sacral region of the spinal cord
487.accessory nerve: arises from two sets of roots (cranial and spinal) that unite to form the nerve
487.optic nerve: the cranial nerve that serves the retina
487.femoral nerve: one of a pair of nerves that originate from lumbar nerves and supply the muscles and skin of the anterior part of the thigh
487.saphenous nerve: a branch of the femoral nerve that supplies cutaneous branches to the inner aspect of the leg and foot
487.trochlear: either of the two cranial nerves on either side that control the superior oblique muscles of the eyes
487.cranial nerve: any of the 12 paired nerves that originate in the brain stem
487.depressor: any nerve whose activity tends to reduce the activity or tone of the body part it serves
487.radial nerve: largest branch of the brachial plexus; extends down the humerus to the lateral epicondyle where it divides into one branch that goes to the skin on the back of the hand and another that goes to the underlying extensor muscles
487.nerve: any bundle of nerve fibers running to various organs and tissues of the body
487.sciatic nerve: arises from the sacral plexus and passes about halfway down the thigh where it divides into the common peroneal and tibial nerves
487.spinal nerve: any of the 31 pairs of nerves emerging from each side of the spinal cord (each attached to the cord by two roots: ventral and dorsal)
487.funny bone: a point on the elbow where the ulnar nerve passes near the surface; a sharp tingling sensation results when the nerve is knocked against the bone
487.ventral root: one of two the two roots of a spinal nerve that passes ventrally from the spinal cord and that consists of motor fibers
487.hypoglossal: supplies intrinsic muscles of the tongue and other tongue muscles
487.lemniscus: a bundle of sensory nerve fibers going to the thalamus
487.phrenic nerve: one of a pair of nerves that arises from cervical spinal roots and passes down the thorax to innervate the diaphragm and control breathing
487.fiber bundle: a bundle of fibers (especially nerve fibers)
487.cervical nerve: any of eight pairs of spinal nerves emerging from the cervical section of the spinal cord
487.lumbar nerve: any of five pairs of spinal nerves emerging from the lumbar section of the spinal cord
487.motor nerve: a nerve that conveys impulses toward or to muscles or glands

274.collegian: a student (or former student) at a college or university

579.repository: a person to whom a secret is entrusted

579.roommate: an associate who shares a room with you

579.alter ego: a very close and trusted friend who seems almost a part of yourself
579.schoolfriend: a friend who attends the same school

194.strophanthin: a bitter and very toxic glycoside derived from plants of the genus Strophanthus; in moderate doses it is a cardiac stimulant but in larger doses it is a powerful poison; used in Africa as an arrow poison

75.vagrant: a wanderer who has no established residence or visible means of support

336.current: a steady flow of a fluid (usually from natural causes)

332.hydrology: the branch of geology that studies water on the earth and in the atmosphere: its distribution and uses and conservation

486.hard tick: ticks having a hard shield on the back and mouth parts that project from the head

486.acarus: any of several mites of the order Acarina

486.Ixodes scapularis: parasitic on mice of genus Peromyscus and bites humans; principal vector for Lyme disease in eastern United States (especially New England); northern form was for a time known as Ixodes dammini (deer tick)

365.pipage: a fee charged for the use of pipes

760.linoleic acid: a liquid polyunsaturated fatty acid abundant in plant fats and oils; a fatty acid essential for nutrition; used to make soap

349.Greco-Roman wrestling: a style of wrestling where the wrestlers are forbidden to tackle or trip or use holds below the waist

349.football: any of various games played with a ball (round or oval) in which two teams try to kick or carry or propel the ball into each other's goal

5.parametric statistic: any statistic computed by procedures that assume the data were drawn from a particular distribution
5.mean: an average of n numbers computed by adding some function of the numbers and dividing by some function of n
5.tau coefficient of correlation: a nonparametric measure of the agreement between two rankings
5.age norm: the average age at which particular performances are expected to appear
5.variance: the second moment around the mean; the expected value of the square of the deviations of a random variable from its mean value
5.nonparametric statistic: a statistic computed without knowledge of the form or the parameters of the distribution from which observations are drawn
5.mode: the most frequent value of a random variable
5.regression coefficient: when the regression line is linear (y = ax + b) the regression coefficient is the constant (a) that represents the rate of change of one variable (y) as a function of changes in the other (x); it is the slope of the regression line
5.demographic: a statistic characterizing human populations (or segments of human populations broken down by age or sex or income etc.)
5.geometric mean: the mean of n numbers expressed as the n-th root of their product
5.standard deviation: the square root of the variance
5.Kendall test: any of several nonparametric measures of correlation (used when the assumptions of standard correlational analysis are not met)
5.harmonic mean: the mean of n numbers expressed as the reciprocal of the arithmetic mean of the reciprocals of the numbers
5.outlier: an extreme deviation from the mean
5.deviation: the difference between an observed value and the expected value of a variable or function
5.split-half correlation: a correlation coefficient calculated between scores on two halves of a test; taken as an indication of the reliability of the test
5.biserial correlation coefficient: a correlation coefficient in which one variable is many-valued and the other is dichotomous
5.vital statistics: data relating to births and deaths and health and diseases and marriages
5.multiple correlation coefficient: an estimate of the combined influence of two or more variables on the observed (dependent) variable
5.phi coefficient: an index of the relation between any two sets of scores that can both be represented on ordered binary dimensions (e.g., male-female)
5.covariance: (statistics) the mean value of the product of the deviations of two variates from their respective means
5.moment: the n-th moment of a distribution is the expected value of the n-th power of the deviations from a fixed value
5.median: the value below which 50% of the cases fall
5.product-moment correlation coefficient: the most commonly used method of computing a correlation coefficient between variables that are linearly related
5.time series: a series of values of a variable at successive times
5.mean deviation: the arithmetic mean of the absolute values of deviations from the mean of a distribution
5.average: a statistic describing the location of a distribution
5.tetrachoric correlation coefficient: a correlation coefficient computed for two normally distributed variables that are both expressed as a dichotomy
5.statistic: a datum that can be represented numerically
5.arithmetic mean: the sum of the values of a random variable divided by the number of values
5.rank-order correlation coefficient: the most commonly used method of computing a correlation coefficient between the ranks of scores on two variables
5.second moment: the expected value of the square of the deviations of a random variable from the point of origin
5.correlation coefficient: a statistic representing how closely two variables co-vary; it can vary from -1 (perfect negative correlation) through 0 (no correlation) to +1 (perfect positive correlation)
5.coefficient of concordance: a coefficient of agreement (concordance) between different sets of rank orderings of the same set of things
5.Kendall partial rank correlation: a nonparametric measure of partial correlation

438.fraud in the inducement: fraud which intentionally causes a person to execute and instrument or make an agreement or render a judgment; e.g., misleading someone about the true facts
438.swindle: the act of swindling by some fraudulent scheme
438.bunco: a swindle in which you cheat at gambling or persuade a person to buy worthless property
438.sting operation: a complicated confidence game planned and executed with great care (especially an operation implemented by undercover agents to apprehend criminals)
438.fraud: intentional deception resulting in injury to another person
438.identity theft: the co-option of another person's personal information (e.g., name, Social Security number, credit card number, passport) without that person's knowledge and the fraudulent use of such knowledge
438.shell game: a swindling sleight-of-hand game; victim guesses which of three things a pellet is under
438.fraud in the factum: fraud that arises from a disparity between the instrument intended to be executed and the instrument actually executed; e.g., leading someone to sign the wrong contract
438.barratry: (maritime law) a fraudulent breach of duty by the master of a ship that injures the owner of the ship or its cargo; includes every breach of trust such as stealing or sinking or deserting the ship or embezzling the cargo
438.election fraud: misrepresentation or alteration of the true results of an election
438.mail fraud: use of the mails to defraud someone
438.constructive fraud: comprises all acts or omissions or concealments involving breach of equitable or legal duty or trust or confidence
438.pyramiding: a fraudulent business practice involving some form of pyramid scheme e.g., the chain of distribution is artificially expanded by an excessive number of distributors selling to other distributors at progressively higher wholesale prices until retail prices are unnecessarily inflated
438.holdout: the act of hiding playing cards in a gambling game so they are available for personal use later
438.fraud in law: fraud that is presumed from the circumstances although the one who commits it need not have had any evil intent
438.fraud in fact: actual deceit; concealing something or making a false representation with an evil intent to cause injury to another
438.intrinsic fraud: fraud (as by use of forged documents or false claims or perjury) that misleads a court or jury and induces a finding for the one perpetrating the fraud
438.extrinsic fraud: fraud that prevents a party from knowing their rights or from having a fair opportunity of presenting them at trial

215.bug: a small hidden microphone; for listening secretly

215.woofer: a loudspeaker that reproduces lower audio frequency sounds

215.condenser microphone: microphone consisting of a capacitor with one plate fixed and the other forming the diaphragm moved by sound waves
215.squawk box: the loudspeaker on an intercom or public address system

215.crystal pickup: a cartridge in which an output voltage is produced by the vibration of a piezoelectric crystal

215.bullhorn: a portable loudspeaker with built-in microphone and amplifier
215.loudspeaker: electro-acoustic transducer that converts electrical signals into sounds loud enough to be heard at a distance

335.scalpel: a thin straight surgical knife used in dissection and surgery
335.hypodermic syringe: a piston syringe that is fitted with a hypodermic needle for giving injections

335.fiberscope: a flexible medical instrument involving fiber optics that is used to examine internal organs
335.proctoscope: an endoscope for examining the rectum
335.sigmoidoscope: an endoscope (a flexible fiberoptic probe) for examining the sigmoid colon
335.electromyograph: a medical instrument that records the electrical waves associated with the activity of skeletal muscles

335.gastroscope: a type of endoscope for visually examining the stomach

335.photocoagulator: surgical instrument containing a laser for use in photocoagulation

335.thermograph: medical instrument that uses an infrared camera to reveal temperature variations on the surface of the body
335.microwave diathermy machine: diathermy machine that uses microwave radiation as the source of heat
335.surgical knife: a very sharp knife used in surgery
335.otoscope: medical instrument consisting of a magnifying lens and light; used for examining the external ear (the auditory meatus and especially the tympanic membrane)
335.surgical instrument: a medical instrument used in surgery
335.artificial kidney: a machine that uses dialysis to remove impurities and waste products from the bloodstream before returning the blood to the patient's body
335.shortwave diathermy machine: a diathermy machine that uses short wave radiation as the source of heat
335.ophthalmoscope: medical instrument for examining the retina of the eye
335.trepan: a surgical instrument used to remove sections of bone from the skull
335.laryngoscope: a medical instrument for examining the larynx
335.autoinjector: a hypodermic syringe to use in injecting yourself with a liquid
335.medical instrument: instrument used in the practice of medicine
335.hemostat: a surgical instrument that stops bleeding by clamping the blood vessel
335.polygraph: a medical instrument that records several physiological processes simultaneously (e.g., pulse rate and blood pressure and respiration and perspiration)
335.ballistocardiograph: a medical instrument that measures the mechanical force of cardiac contractions and the amount of blood passing through the heart during a specified period by measuring the recoil of the body as blood is pumped from the ventricles
335.douche: a small syringe with detachable nozzles; used for vaginal lavage and enemas

335.stethoscope: a medical instrument for listening to the sounds generated inside the body

223.conch: any of various edible tropical marine gastropods of the genus Strombus having a brightly-colored spiral shell with large outer lip
223.cowrie: any of numerous tropical marine gastropods of the genus Cypraea having highly polished usually brightly marked shells

223.garden snail: any of several inedible snails of the genus Helix; often destructive pests

223.neritina: ornately marked and brightly colored snails of brackish waters
223.scorpion shell: any of numerous tropical marine snails that as adults have the outer lip of the aperture produced into a series of long curved spines

223.river limpet: minute conical gastropod superficially resembling a limpet but living and feeding on freshwater plants
223.limpet: any of various usually marine gastropods with low conical shells; found clinging to rocks in littoral areas
223.abalone: any of various large edible marine gastropods of the genus Haliotis having an ear-shaped shell with pearly interior

223.triton: tropical marine gastropods having beautifully colored spiral shells
223.physa: any member of the genus Physa

223.bleeding tooth: gastropod having reddish toothlike projections around the shell opening; of the Caribbean area
223.money cowrie: cowrie whose shell is used for money in parts of the southern Pacific and in parts of Africa

223.bubble shell: marine gastropod mollusk having a very small thin shell

316.feasting: eating an elaborate meal (often accompanied by entertainment)

11.adjudication: the final judgment in a legal proceeding; the act of pronouncing judgment based on the evidence presented

286.honoree: a recipient of honors in recognition of noteworthy accomplishments

344.bloom: a rosy color (especially in the cheeks) taken as a sign of good health

475.sundress: a light loose sleeveless summer dress with a wide neckline and thin shoulder straps that expose the arms and shoulders

409.show trial: a trial held for show; the guilt of the accused person has been decided in advance
409.retrial: a new trial in which issues already litigated and to which the court has already rendered a verdict or decision are reexamined by the same court; occurs when the initial trial is found to have been improper or unfair due to procedural errors
409.civil suit: a lawsuit alleging violations of civil law by the defendant
409.judicial review: review by a court of law of actions of a government official or entity or of some other legally appointed person or body or the review by an appellate court of the decision of a trial court
409.prosecution: the institution and conduct of legal proceedings against a defendant for criminal behavior
409.foreclosure: the legal proceedings initiated by a creditor to repossess the collateral for loan that is in default
409.naturalization: the proceeding whereby a foreigner is granted citizenship
409.paternity suit: a lawsuit filed to determine the father of a child born out of wedlock (and to provide for the support of the child once paternity is determined)
409.court-martial: a trial that is conducted by a military court
409.civil action: legal action to protect a private civil right or to compel a civil remedy (as distinguished from criminal prosecution)
409.quo warranto: a hearing to determine by what authority someone has an office or franchise or liberty
409.ordeal: a primitive method of determining a person's guilt or innocence by subjecting the accused person to dangerous or painful tests believed to be under divine control; escape was usually taken as a sign of innocence
409.countersuit: a suit brought against someone who has sued you
409.administrative hearing: a hearing that takes place outside the judicial process before hearing examiners who have been granted judicial authority specifically for the purpose of conducting such hearings
409.intervention: (law) a proceeding that permits a person to enter into a lawsuit already in progress; admission of person not an original party to the suit so that person can protect some right or interest that is allegedly affected by the proceedings
409.proceeding: (law) the institution of a sequence of steps by which legal judgments are invoked
409.Scopes trial: a highly publicized trial in 1925 when John Thomas Scopes violated a Tennessee state law by teaching evolution in high school; Scopes was prosecuted by William Jennings Bryan and defended by Clarence Darrow; Scopes was convicted but the verdict was later reversed
409.appeal: (law) a legal proceeding in which the appellant resorts to a higher court for the purpose of obtaining a review of a lower court decision and a reversal of the lower court's judgment or the granting of a new trial
409.moot: a hypothetical case that law students argue as an exercise
409.custody case: a legal action to determine custody (usually of children following a divorce)
409.litigation: a legal proceeding in a court; a judicial contest to determine and enforce legal rights
409.review: (law) a judicial reexamination of the proceedings of a court (especially by an appellate court)
409.mistrial: a trial that is invalid or inconclusive
409.counterclaim: a claim filed in opposition to another claim in a legal action
409.antitrust case: a legal action brought against parties who are charged with limiting free competition in the market place
409.test case: a representative legal action whose outcome is likely to become a precedent
409.trial: (law) the determination of a person's innocence or guilt by due process of law
409.class action: a lawsuit brought by a representative member of a large group of people on behalf of all members of the group
409.hearing: (law) a proceeding (usually by a court) where evidence is taken for the purpose of determining an issue of fact and reaching a decision based on that evidence
409.bill of review: a proceeding brought to obtain an explanation or an alteration or a reversal of a decree by the court that rendered it
409.procedure: a mode of conducting legal and parliamentary proceedings
409.competence hearing: a hearing to determine legal capacity (to determine whether the defendant can understand the charges and cooperate with a lawyer in preparing a defense)
409.legal action: a judicial proceeding brought by one party against another; one party prosecutes another for a wrong done or for protection of a right or for prevention of a wrong
409.recusation: (law) an objection grounded on the judge's relationship to one of the parties
409.lawsuit: a comprehensive term for any proceeding in a court of law whereby an individual seeks a legal remedy
409.custody battle: litigation to settle custody of the children of a divorced couple
409.objection: (law) a procedure whereby a party to a suit says that a particular line of questioning or a particular witness or a piece of evidence or other matter is improper and should not be continued and asks the court to rule on its impropriety or illegality
409.vexatious litigation: litigation shown to have been instituted maliciously and without probable cause
409.criminal suit: a lawsuit alleging violations of criminal law by the defendant
409.double jeopardy: the prosecution of a defendant for a criminal offense for which he has already been tried; prohibited in the fifth amendment to the United States Constitution
409.receivership: a court action that places property under the control of a receiver during litigation so that it can be preserved for the benefit of all
409.fair hearing: a hearing that is granted in extraordinary situations where the normal judicial process would be inadequate to secure due process because the person would be harmed or denied their rights before a judicial remedy became available (as in deportation or loss of welfare benefits)
409.adoption: a legal proceeding that creates a parent-child relation between persons not related by blood; the adopted child is entitled to all privileges belonging to a natural child of the adoptive parents (including the right to inherit)
409.bankruptcy: a legal process intended to insure equality among the creditors of a corporation declared to be insolvent

331.rock rattlesnake: mountain rock dweller of Mexico and most southern parts of United States southwest

331.pit viper: New World vipers with hollow fangs and a heat-sensitive pit on each side of the head
331.Western diamondback: largest and most dangerous North American snake; of southwestern United States and Mexico
331.diamondback: large deadly rattlesnake with diamond-shaped markings
331.timber rattlesnake: widely distributed in rugged ground of eastern United States
331.sidewinder: small pale-colored desert rattlesnake of southwestern United States; body moves in an s-shaped curve

511.Aristotelian logic: the syllogistic logic of Aristotle as developed by Boethius in the Middle Ages
511.propositional logic: a branch of symbolic logic dealing with propositions as units and with their combinations and the connectives that relate them
511.deontic logic: the modal logic of obligation and permissibility

529.leverage: the mechanical advantage gained by being in a position to use a lever
529.grip: the friction between a body and the surface on which it moves (as between an automobile tire and the road)

529.sound: mechanical vibrations transmitted by an elastic medium

529.trajectory: the path followed by an object moving through space

301.short account: a brokerage account of someone who sells short (sells securities he does not own)
301.brokerage account: a fund that a customer has entrusted to a securities brokerage

182.loop knot: any of various knots used to make a fixed loop in a rope
182.slipknot: a knot at the end of a cord or rope that can slip along the cord or rope around which it is made
182.Blackwall hitch: a simple hitch used for temporarily attaching a line to a hook
182.fisherman's bend: a knot for tying a line to a spar or ring
182.hawser bend: a knot uniting the ends of two lines
182.knot: any of various fastenings formed by looping and tying a rope (or cord) upon itself or to another rope or to another object
182.stopper knot: a knot that prevents a rope from passing through a hole
182.rolling hitch: a hitch for fastening a line to a spar or another rope
182.love knot: a stylized or decorative knot used as an emblem of love
182.bowline: a loop knot that neither slips nor jams
182.sheet bend: a hitch used for temporarily tying a rope to the middle of another rope (or to an eye)
182.sheepshank: a knot for shortening a line
182.square knot: a double knot made of two half hitches and used to join the ends of two cords
182.prolonge knot: a knot in the rope used to drag a gun carriage
182.barrel knot: a knot used for tying fishing leaders together; the ends of the two leaders are wrapped around each other two or three times
182.magnus hitch: a rolling hitch similar to a clove hitch
182.figure eight: a knot having the shape of the numeral 8; tied in a rope that has been passed through a hole or pulley and that prevents the rope from coming loose
182.granny knot: a reef knot crossed the wrong way and therefore insecure
182.overhand knot: a simple small knot (often used as part of other knots)
182.clove hitch: a knot used to fasten a line temporarily to a post or spar
182.Turk's head: an ornamental knot that resembles a small turban
182.reef knot: a square knot used in a reef line
182.timber hitch: a hitch used to secure a rope to a log or spar; often supplemented by a half hitch
182.carrick bend: a knot used to connect the ends of two large ropes or hawsers
182.half hitch: a knot used to fasten a rope temporarily to an object; usually tied double
182.Gordian knot: an intricate knot tied by Gordius, the king of Phrygia, and cut by the sword of Alexander the Great after he heard that whoever undid it would become ruler of Asia
182.bow: a knot with two loops and loose ends; used to tie shoelaces
182.cat's-paw: a hitch in the middle of rope that has two eyes into which tackle can be hooked
182.Windsor knot: a wide triangular slipknot for tying a tie
182.fisherman's knot: a knot for tying the ends of two lines together
182.hitch: a knot that can be undone by pulling against the strain that holds it; a temporary knot
182.surgeon's knot: any of several knots used in tying stitches or ligatures

446.electronic warfare-support measures: electronic warfare undertaken under direct control of an operational commander to locate sources of radiated electromagnetic energy for the purpose of immediate threat recognition
446.imitative electronic deception: the introduction of electromagnetic energy into enemy systems that imitates enemy emissions
446.electronic deception: the deliberate use of electromagnetic energy in a manner intended to convey misleading information
446.manipulative electronic deception: actions to eliminate revealing telltale indicators that could be used by the enemy (or to convey misleading indicators)
446.electronic countermeasures: electronic warfare undertaken to prevent or reduce an enemy's effective use of the electromagnetic spectrum
446.jamming: deliberate radiation or reflection of electromagnetic energy for the purpose of disrupting enemy use of electronic devices or systems
446.electronic counter-countermeasures: electronic warfare undertaken to insure effective friendly use of the electromagnetic spectrum in spite of the enemy's use of electronic warfare
446.simulative electronic deception: actions to represent friendly notional or actual capabilities to mislead hostile forces
446.spot jamming: electronic jamming of a specific channel or frequency
446.barrage jamming: electronic jamming over a wide range of frequencies simultaneously
446.electromagnetic intrusion: the deliberate insertion of electromagnetic energy into transmission paths with the objective of confusing or deceiving operators
446.electronic warfare: military action involving the use of electromagnetic energy to determine or exploit or reduce or prevent hostile use of the electromagnetic spectrum

276.war chest: a fund accumulated to finance a war (or a political campaign)
276.revolving fund: a fund which, if borrowed or used, is intended to be replenished so it may be loaned or spent repeatedly
276.money: the most common medium of exchange; functions as legal tender
276.budget: a sum of money allocated for a particular purpose

276.pension fund: a fund reserved to pay workers' pensions when they retire from service

276.subsidization: money (or other benefits) obtained as a subsidy

276.token money: coins of regular issue whose face value is greater than their intrinsic value
276.fund: a reserve of money set aside for some purpose
276.exchange traded fund: a mutual fund that is traded on a stock exchange
276.appropriation: money set aside (as by a legislature) for a specific purpose
276.deposit: money deposited in a bank or some similar institution
276.pork barrel: a legislative appropriation designed to ingratiate legislators with their constituents

68.phatic speech: conversational speech used to communicate sociability more than information

68.chitchat: light informal conversation for social occasions

54.Vichy water: sparkling mineral water from springs at Vichy, France or water similar to it

591.myelography: roentgenography of the spinal cord to detect possible lesions (usually after injection of a contrast medium into the subarachnoid space)
591.lymphangiography: roentgenographic examination of lymph nodes and lymph vessels after injection of a radiopaque contrast medium; produces a lymphangiogram
591.pyelography: roentgenography of the kidney and ureters (usually after injection with a radiopaque dye)
591.radiography: photography that uses other kinds of radiation than visible light
591.intravenous pyelography: performing pyelography with intravenous injection of a contrast medium
591.xeroradiography: radiography using X-rays and xerographic (rather than roentgenographic) techniques
591.roentgenography: radiography that uses X-rays to produce a roentgenogram
591.angiography: roentgenographic examination of blood vessels after injection of a radiopaque contrast medium; produces an angiogram
591.arthrography: roentgenographic examination of a joint after injection of radiopaque contrast medium; produces an arthrogram
591.encephalography: roentgenography of the brain after spinal fluid has been replaced by a gas (usually oxygen); produces an encephalogram
591.cholangiography: roentgenographic examination of the bile ducts after a contrast medium has been injected

470.sedimentary rock: rock formed from consolidated clay sediments
470.shale: a sedimentary rock formed by the deposition of successive layers of clay
470.oil shale: shale from which oil can be obtained by heating
470.firestone: a sandstone that withstands intense heat; used to line fireplaces and furnaces and kilns
470.humic shale: shale that is rich in humic acids
470.bluestone: bluish-grey sandstone used for paving and building

470.rottenstone: a weathered and decomposed siliceous limestone; in powdered form it is used in polishing

470.slate: a fine-grained metamorphic rock that can be split into thin layers

121.classical architecture: architecture influenced by the ancient Greeks or Romans
121.architectural style: architecture as a kind of art form
121.Norman architecture: a Romanesque style first appearing in Normandy around 950 AD and used in Britain from the Norman Conquest until the 12th century
121.Gothic: a style of architecture developed in northern France that spread throughout Europe between the 12th and 16th centuries; characterized by slender vertical piers and counterbalancing buttresses and by vaulting and pointed arches
121.Byzantine architecture: the style of architecture developed in the Byzantine Empire developed after the 5th century; massive domes with square bases and round arches and spires and much use of mosaics
121.Tudor architecture: a style of English-Gothic architecture popular during the Tudor period; characterized by half-timbered houses
121.perpendicular: a Gothic style in 14th and 15th century England; characterized by vertical lines and a four-centered (Tudor) arch and fan vaulting
121.Moorish: a style of architecture common in Spain from the 13th to 16th centuries; characterized by horseshoe-shaped arches
121.Victorian architecture: a style of architecture used in Britain during the reign of Queen Victoria; characterized by massive construction and elaborate ornamentation
121.Romanesque: a style of architecture developed in Italy and western Europe between the Roman and the Gothic styles after 1000 AD; characterized by round arches and vaults and by the substitution of piers for columns and profuse ornament and arcades
121.Bauhaus: a German style of architecture begun by Walter Gropius in 1918

623.behalf: as the agent of or on someone's part (usually expressed as  rather than )

29.retardation: lack of normal development of intellectual capacities

29.folly: the quality of being rash and foolish

617.colon: the part of the large intestine between the cecum and the rectum; it extracts moisture from food residues before they are excreted

617.small intestine: the longest part of the alimentary canal; where digestion is completed

702.dumb bomb: a bomb that falls because of gravity and is not guided to a target

702.hand grenade: a grenade designed to be thrown by hand
702.gas shell: (military) bomb consisting of an explosive projectile filled with a toxic gas that is released when the bomb explodes
702.clean bomb: an atom bomb leaving little or no radioactive contamination
702.remote-control bomb: a bomb that can be detonated by remote control
702.blockbuster: a large bomb used to demolish extensive areas (as a city block)
702.cluster bomb: bomb consisting of a canister that is dropped from a plane and that opens to release a cluster of bomblets (usually fragmentation bombs) over a wide area
702.time bomb: a bomb that has a detonating mechanism that can be set to go off at a particular time
702.bomblet: one of the smaller bombs that are released from a cluster bomb
702.depth charge: a bomb that explodes at a preset depth under water; antisubmarine device
702.stink bomb: a small bomb designed to give off a foul odor when it explodes
702.microwave bomb: a bomb that explodes in midair and releases a massive burst of electromagnetic energy sufficient to disable computers and telecommunications without killing people or damaging buildings
702.briefcase bomb: a bomb consisting of an explosive and timer hidden inside a briefcase
702.laser-guided bomb: a smart bomb that seeks the laser light reflected off of the target and uses it to correct its descent
702.general-purpose bomb: a large bomb (500 to 2,000 pounds that is 50% explosive) whose explosion creates a blast and whose metal casing creates some fragmentation effect
702.incendiary bomb: a bomb that is designed to start fires; is most effective against flammable targets (such as fuel)
702.thermobaric bomb: a bomb that uses a fuel-air explosive
702.car bomb: a bomb placed in a car and wired to explode when the ignition is started or by remote control or by a timing device
702.Bunker Buster: a 5,000 pound laser-guided bomb that can be programmed to penetrate to a given depth before exploding; used to penetrate hardened underground facilities
702.grenade: a small explosive bomb thrown by hand or fired from a missile
702.smoke bomb: a bomb that gives off thick smoke when it explodes; used to make a smoke screen or to mark a position
702.cruise missile: an unmanned aircraft that is a self-contained bomb
702.neutron bomb: atom bomb that produces lethal neutrons with less blast
702.atom bomb: a nuclear weapon in which enormous energy is released by nuclear fission (splitting the nuclei of a heavy element like uranium 235 or plutonium 239)
702.letter bomb: a thin explosive device inside an envelope or package and detonated when opened
702.balloon bomb: a bomb carried by a balloon
702.dirty bomb: an atom bomb that leaves considerable radioactive contamination
702.penetration bomb: a bomb with about 30% explosive and a casing designed to penetrate hardened targets before the explosive detonates
702.smart bomb: a bomb that can be guided (by a laser beam or radio) to its target

282.bar: a counter where you can obtain food or drink

543.bee fly: hairy nectar-eating fly that resembles a bee; larvae are parasitic on larvae of bees and related insects

383.scoinson arch: an arch that supports part of the wall
383.rampant arch: an arch whose support is higher on one side than on the other
383.triumphal arch: a monumental archway; usually they are built to commemorate some notable victory
383.ogee arch: a pointed arch having an S-shape on both sides
383.broken arch: an arch with a gap at the apex; the gap is usually filled with some decoration
383.three-centered arch: a round arch whose inner curve is drawn with circles having three centers
383.camber arch: an arch with a straight horizontal extrados and a slightly arched intrados
383.trefoil arch: a pointed arch having cusps in the intrados on either side of the apex
383.corbel arch: (architecture) an arch constructed of masonry courses that are corbelled until they meet
383.proscenium arch: the arch over the opening in the proscenium wall
383.flat arch: an arch with mutually supporting voussoirs that has a straight horizontal extrados and intrados
383.Tudor arch: a low elliptical or pointed arch; usually drawn from four centers
383.round arch: an arch formed in a continuous curve; characteristic of Roman architecture
383.lancet arch: an acutely pointed Gothic arch, like a lance
383.pointed arch: an arch with a pointed apex; characteristic of Gothic architecture
383.trimmer arch: an arch built between trimmers in a floor (to support the weight of a hearth)
383.skew arch: an arch whose jambs are not at right angles with the face
383.Roman arch: a round arch drawn from a single center
383.arch: (architecture) a masonry construction (usually curved) for spanning an opening and supporting the weight above it
383.Moorish arch: a round arch that widens before rounding off
383.Gothic arch: a pointed arch; usually has a joint (instead of a keystone) at the apex
383.bell arch: a round arch resting on corbels
383.drop arch: a blunt pointed arch drawn from two centers within the span
383.rowlock arch: an arch that is formed with more than one concentric row of voussoirs
383.shouldered arch: an arch consisting of a horizontal lintel supported at each end by corbels that project into the aperture
383.skeen arch: an arch whose height is less than half its width
383.safety arch: an undecorated arch that is included in order to strengthen or support a construction
383.segmental arch: a shallow arch; an arch that is less than a semicircle
383.squinch: a small arch built across the interior angle of two walls (usually to support a spire)
383.abutment arch: an arch supported by an abutment

161.education: knowledge acquired by learning and instruction

230.full nelson: a wrestling hold in which the holder puts both arms under the opponent's arms and exerts pressure on the back of the neck (illegal in amateur wrestling)

132.articulatory system: the system of joints in the body
132.urinary tract: the organs and tubes involved in the production and excretion of urine
132.venation: (zoology) the system of venous blood vessels in an animal
132.muscular structure: the muscular system of an organism
132.circulatory system: the organs and tissues involved in circulating blood and lymph through the body
132.nervous system: the sensory and control apparatus consisting of a network of nerve cells
132.urogenital system: the system that includes all organs involved in reproduction and in the formation and voidance of urine
132.exoskeleton: the exterior protective or supporting structure or shell of many animals (especially invertebrates) including bony or horny parts such as nails or scales or hoofs
132.parasympathetic nervous system: originates in the brain stem and lower part of the spinal cord; opposes physiological effects of the sympathetic nervous system: stimulates digestive secretions; slows the heart; constricts the pupils; dilates blood vessels
132.musculoskeletal system: the system of muscles and tendons and ligaments and bones and joints and associated tissues that move the body and maintain its form
132.respiratory system: the system for taking in oxygen and giving off carbon dioxide; in terrestrial animals this is accomplished by breathing

132.skeletal system: the hard structure (bones and cartilages) that provides a frame for the body of an animal
132.tract: a system of body parts that together serve some particular purpose

132.fetal circulation: the system of blood vessels and structures through which blood moves in a fetus
132.sensory system: the body's system of sense organs
132.system: a group of physiologically or anatomically related organs or parts
132.peripheral nervous system: the section of the nervous system lying outside the brain and spinal cord
132.mononuclear phagocyte system: a widely distributed system of free and fixed macrophages derived from bone marrow
132.upper respiratory tract: the nose and throat and trachea
132.water vascular system: system of fluid-filled tubes used by echinoderms in locomotion and feeding and respiration

132.reproductive system: organs and tissues involved in the production and maturation of gametes and in their union and subsequent development as offspring
132.vestibular apparatus: organs mediating the labyrinthine sense; concerned with equilibrium
132.respiratory tract: the passages through which air enters and leaves the body
132.endocrine system: the system of glands that produce endocrine secretions that help to control bodily metabolic activity
132.central nervous system: the portion of the vertebrate nervous system consisting of the brain and spinal cord
